review_text: I‚Äôve stayed in a hostel once before, and this one is nothing like what I imagined a hostel to be. The place is wonderfully cozy, warm, and has a homey feel. The location is excellent, the pods are comfortable, place is squeaky clean and the staff is amazing. On top of that, they even offer breakfast and really great coffee for guests. For the price and location, it‚Äôs unbeatable. I would definitely stay here again!

The people in the photo (hosts) are not the people I ever saw at this location and don't seem to be on site. It was as described, and you should know that it is run by Hare Krishna. They are doing great work and offer simple meals at any time of the day to anyone staying. Everything was clean, and all of the hosts were friendly! I would stay here again!

this is my fifth time visiting manhattan and this is my definitely amongst my favorites for accommodations i've stayed in. very cozy and clean, you'll feel right at home! they always have food and drink for guests, and the bathroom is even kept well stocked. it's nice and quiet as well, with quite a safe and comfortable feeling atmosphere. very kind and warm hosts that keep a lovely place, i'd definitely stay here again next time i'm here

I love this place! As newbie coming into the city for work trips, this hostel is perfect for a couple days. The location is an easy walk from penn station, the staff is kind, and the place feels safe. Inside, it is clean, welcoming, and warm with snacks and coffee. The only issue I had were the late arrivals, 11 pm or 12 am, keeping me awake when I had to work in the morning. Otherwise, it's is great for a solo trip!

I have never stayed in a hostel before so I was a little nervous at first. This was a great experience. Photos are accurate. Everyone was respectful about quiet hours. The community area and kitchen was fantastic. The scones are amazing!! The staff is so helpful and friendly. I had no problems at all. I would definitely come back!

The host are very welcoming & explain everything to you about the place when you arrive. There‚Äôs always someone in the office 24/7 if you need to reach out. This is my go to whenever I‚Äôm in NYC. Beautiful Zen space for the solo traveler. I love the Chelsea neighborhood. The Italian restaurant & improv theater is right around the corner. Both are excellent! I highly recommend. üôè

The place was more expensive then what I would expect, but I enjoyed the location and hostel. the staff was really nice, the site was flexible in access, and the space was super clean and organized. I would definitely visit again based on it's proximity to work, the train, and my favorite places in Manhattan. Instructions were super understandable and the communication with the host was great!

great place. exactly as described. friendly hosts and staff. the place is so clean, and the location is perfect. the 24hrs check-in option really worked for me! Read the description carefully, it is not a typical stay. (the fact that sound travels easily can interrupt your sleep if you are a light-sleeper.

My husband stayed here for one night and then had to leave it was so bad. Hugely misrepresented in the airbnb photos and reviews. The cubicles were like cells. It was horribly loud, you could hear literally everything. He said he heard talking, snoring, and farting well into the night and even with earplugs he couldn't sleep. Bodily functions don't obey quiet hours. The hosts were kind and it was clean but this is bare bones. Is it really so expensive to put up some real walls? At least old school hostels used to have actual rooms.

The staff is great, the room is clean, and the overall atmosphere is cozy. The team was very attentive and strongly emphasized the importance of keeping quiet. During the night, I understood why. Since the cubicles are not closed at the top, you can hear absolutely everything other guests do during the night. For me, this was unbearable, and I had to cancel my reservation the following day. I only recommend this place if you are a very heavy sleeper.

4 years on Airbnb Rating, 5 stars , ¬∑ 2 days ago This place was fantastic for the budget. I couldn‚Äôt ask for more. The daily free breakfast of bread, milk, and fresh fruits basically pays for itself to a certain extent. The room is small so it‚Äôs perfect for people that just need a place to sleep. But one thing to note is that you can‚Äôt bring any meat product in the building - which includes eggs and any canned food. It was a challenge for me to find affordable high quality protein for myself that needs to be eaten outside, so keep this in mind.

Great stay, very affordable, clean showers and bathrooms. Nice breakfast area and fun cubicle like rooms with good wifi. Excellent location, staff is always available on demand 24/7 would book again a heartbeat.

The place is very clean and cozy. It is very helpful having someone 24/7 at the reception. It feels safe. There are a lot of breakfast options. Everyone is friendly. It is good value for the cost definitely.
very good spot for a short stay in NY ! extremely well located, flexibility with check in, breakfast available, kind and responsive people. I can recommend it with my full heart !

I had an amazing time at this place! The location is just great, and the amenities were surprisingly nice. Yana's scones are THE BEST thing ever, and she's a lovely person. Shout out to Jeremy, who was so nice as well. I look forward to staying here the next time I visit NYC.

This was my second time staying at Interfaith and I‚Äôll definitely be back again! The location is absolutely incredible - 20 min walk to the Theatre District and Times Square. Staff are so pleasant and accommodating. Highly recommend.

This place exceeded my expectation! It is a hostel style so all the cubicles are small and not closed all the way up (important!). However, due to well management, guests are fairly quite and considerate of others so my stay was easy and calm.

Wonderful place to be for a solo trip in the city of New York for the first time ever. I enjoyed how small and relaxed the place was. Was very clean and comfortable. I loved how close to everything the building was. Definitely hope to stay soon.

My only complaint is that the cubicle got kinda hot at night which made it difficult to sleep. I also encountered a guest who was trying to check in late at night and was not able to reach anyone on the phone. My check in went fine though. Overall I had a great stay

clean, comfortable, convenient described very accurately read everything in the ad and in the messages and emails to know what to expect 24hour access to a variety of food was great friendly, helpful staff

This place is exactly what is described. The location was great. It‚Äôs all I needed for my trip since I was only there for 24 hours. It‚Äôs walkable to everything, there are subway stations within 4 mins. I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better spot.

This was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend staying here if you‚Äôre a solo traveler. The place is just as pictured and close to many of the main attractions. I wish I could‚Äôve stayed longer.

It is as described. Place to sleep and shower. If that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for, it works well. Right by the ACE and 123 line, and Penn station. Instructions to check in and out were clear and easy.

Had a wonderful stay! Walkable distance to touristic places as well as the subway so transportation was easily accessible. I felt respected by the host and other guest. Communication was great and easy going! Will definitely stay again.

As a first time solo traveler to NYC, this was the best place to stay I could have ever asked for. Loved how close it was to Penn Station, the ability to hold my luggage before and after check out, and how responsive the hosts were! Such a bang for your buck, I would recommend it to anyone!

Amazing prime location, and very good price for that location. But some conditions like no non vegetarian foods allowed and lack of roof(everything is audible to everyone in that floor); these conditions are little harsh. But they were mentioned clearly while booking the room, so read throughly. Definitely need to vacate, if we violate the conditions. Other than food and sound privacy, host is amazing and friendly, very responsive and respectful. Nice location and price. Check conditions and book.

This was my second time at this location. I had stayed at the New York Spirit Retreat (same location 4th floor) earlier and was pleasantly surprised to see the difference in comfort at Interfaith- the bathrooms are much more spacious and the space overall is much more comfortable. Love the common area on the 3rd floor. As a vegetarian myself, I loved that no meat, eggs and fish are allowed. The staff is responsive and amiable. I loved reading, praying and connecting with more folks at the building. The muffins were my favorite.

This is my second time at this hostel and once again everything was great. They really take care of you and make sure everything is squeaky clean! Staff are all helpful and kitchen options are awesome. Thanks again guys!

Booked for 4 day 3 nights, but couldn't stay there after the first night and checked myself into a hotel. Everyone around you is snoring; and they employ a Chinese lady at night to keep watch and wake up snorers - but you can't sleep either way. 25 cubicles with beds 3/4 size of a single bed, and only 3 bathrooms and showers, walking around in circles to get there. If you're on a tight budget this might be for you, but if you have some standards book yourself a hotel.
Lovely, accommodating, and communicative hosts. This Airbnb is situated unbelievable close to the ‚Äúheart‚Äù of NYC. I couldn‚Äôt have chosen a better place to stay and I‚Äôll definitely be back.
This is my go to place whenever I‚Äôm in the city. Very convenient Penn Station and the word authority. I always feel at home there very Zen and peaceful. Highly recommend.

Excellent location‚Äîeverything was within easy walking distance, which made the stay especially convenient. A thoughtful touch: complimentary earplugs were provided, which proved helpful at night given the close proximity to neighboring guests.

It‚Äôs my go to place when I‚Äôm in the city. Chelsea is very convenient to Penn Station & Port Authority. Friendly and helpful staff! Zen & peaceful. I highly recommend for the solo traveler. üòä‚òÆÔ∏è

A wonderful place with a very pleasant atmosphere. You can really feel the care for guests: cleanliness, order, and comfort are at a high level. The staff is friendly and helpful. A great option both for a short stay and for long-term accommodation. Thank you for the hospitality!

It was an amazing stay, had the best time. Definitely recommend this place to others, and for myself too, for the next time! Absolutely clean, hyegenic, and a good vibes stay! Loved it, had so much peace. Thank you !

I‚Äôm really glad I stayed here. The room was always kept extremely clean, and the location was very convenient for getting anywhere. It felt like it gave me more time to truly enjoy my trip. I would definitely love to stay here again!
It has been a nice experience staying in new york city which was my "home" in a short period, and this stay was very friendly and the cost is unprecedentedly nice and the home made cookies are nice.

Just what I was looking for everything is super nice, I arrived in the morning and they offered me breakfast, it was incredible, and the day of my departure they kept my things to continue enjoying NY, super recommended... just don't make noise that if it's very serious.

This is a good option if you are in need of a place for the night. You get what you see in the photo - for walls and a mattress. My stay was decent, everyone seemed to understand the rules and were respectful of each other.

My first time visiting in new york city and so glad I booked this bnb ‚ù§Ô∏è I got well rested and people at the front desk are nice too! Great people and great team! I will definitely come back here when I visit new york again ü•∞

If you need a simple bed and private ‚Äúroom‚Äù for a very good price in the nearby of NYC, this is it. Perfect for solo travelers and if you want a budget bed to crash on. Showers, toast/bagel breakfast, and the private, locking door space are great for the prime location next to MSG and Penn Station
Perfect location, very clean. Easy check in and out - thank you for making everything so convenient!

PROS: Location is top notch. The staff is VERY friendly. Shared bathrooms/showers very clean. Water machine broke one day and was immediately worked on and fixed. The staff is great. Love that they offer drinks and small snacks at all hours. Staff member there at all times. CONS: It is small- so do you research and check measurements- I'm 5'9 and the bed was too small for me. I hit my head twice in the bathroom- but again they do list measurements in listing so just make sure room would work for you. My biggest complaint is the noise. They do their best- but there are snorers. You will hear MULTIPLE alarms going off all before 7am (some being hit on snooze or just left on for minutes at a time) and even though they have "quiet hours" there will phone calls/facetimes all around you. The best sleep I got was midday- but my sleep was severely affected unfortunately by other tenants. So it's the roll of the dice and hope you get decent people with manners. Besides the noise- great stay.

Great solution if you want to stay for a few nights in Manhattan on a budget! Perfect location, quite clean, friendly staff available 24/7, breakfast included. The ceiling of the cubicle is open, so you'll get the snores (and smell) of your neighbors, but it's clearly communicated in advance. I stayed 6 nights; during two nights the staff woke up others to stop them from snoring, and one night the police even came because someone didn't collaborate. The staff handled everything very well though and I never felt unsafe, but even with earplugs I found it sometimes difficult to sleep. Lastly, Im 6'3" (190 cm), and didn't fit flat on the bed as it was a bit short. Luckily I'm a side sleeper! Would definitely recommend and come back as well! Thanks a lot!
Lovely hostel. Rooms are small but if silo traveling it‚Äôs perfect. It‚Äôs also in Manhattan so it makes traveling easy. 10/10 I‚Äôd stay again! Friendly staff.

This place is budget-friendly, and has a walkable distance to great restaurants and metro stations. The hosts are easy to communicate with; the staffs are professional and available 24/7; the restroom is surprisingly clean with spotless toilets. As mentioned in the description, the rooms are not soundproof. I appreciate the hosts for being upfront on this issue, and for their efforts in maintaining the quietness, such as having the quiet hour from 8pm-8am, and providing the earplugs. However, there are about 10--20 guests, so it is hard to make sure that everyone stays quiet throughout the night. I am kind of a light sleeper, but I am on budget, so I tried this place; I turn out to be ok with staying for one night, but two nights or anytime longer starts to be difficult for me.
Great place to stay if you are in the city by yourself. The hosts are very friendly and considerate with privacy and respect
I loved the cubicle, it gave me everything I needed with was a place to sleep and enjoy the areas of the city.
My second stay and it was just as great as the first time. Excellent location, quiet accommodations, all for a great price.
The place was cozy and nice, perfect for single travelers who need a cheap stay in central NY
A truly meaningful stay. Volunteering was a wonderful experience, and the hosts were incredibly kind. Great location.

Definitely recommend to people who are solo travelers. I always wanted to go to NYC alone but did not want to pay 200$ by myself for a hotel room. Also I love watching musicals, going to jazz bars so saving money by staying in New jersey was a bit tricky. I would say this is the best place if u are wanting to enjoy the night of NYC + want to stay close to the penn station. It is 5 min walk from Penn station and the broadway is 7-10 min walk. The famous Jazz bars which I love to go, birdland is also 7 min walk. Absolutely loved it. About the bathroom, I kinda have anxiety of sharing bathrooms but to my surprise it was always clean. Loved it. The only thing I will say is about the bed size. It was fine with me to sleep on but I do not think you will have a good sleep if you are a big person, tall or big :) Anyways the staff members are also nice and u can drop your bags in the place which is really helpful if u r planning to immediately start hanging around in NYC.
A great stay for the price in Chelsea. It‚Äôs communal living and everything is spotless, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Definitely a go-to stay when in NYC.
Terrific location, well-run hostel, friendly and helpful staff. Will absolutely stay there again.

I had a great time at this hotel! My room had an amazing view, the location was right where I wanted to be, in Times Square, near different theaters. The check in and check out were very easy. All in all, I would stay in this hotel again and make sure to stay in it if i wanted to stay near Times Square again.

I had a great experience staying at the Hilton in New York City, from the moment I checked in, to the moment I checked out. Michelle at the front desk, was very helpful and even checked us in early. I‚Äôve stayed in New York multiple times and this was by far the best place I‚Äôve ever stayed at and also the cleanest. It‚Äôs in the great location and I would definitely stay here again!

Great location for getting around. Near to all underground stations. Good heating in the room. Room was quite small and nowhere to put heavy clothes. Kept it all in the cases! Comfy bed. Coffee maker and microwave.
We completely enjoyed our stay. It is central to everything which made commuting and seeing sights easy. Host was great and answered my questions beforehand. I would definitely come back!

I absolutely loved my stay here. I would highly recommend it if you‚Äôre coming to NYC for the first time. Everything is walkable, Times Square is right there, and subways are nearby. Staff was incredibly kind, and Jason was a very friendly and responsive host.

E3ally liked the experience apart from the $30/night charge that was added to 2hat I paid through Airbnb. Supposedly for wifi and dry cleaning whether you need it or not. Other coupons were included but this significant additional expense per night came as a surprise at check in.

Great location. Walkable from time square and right in front of the hop on hop off stop which was extremely convenient. Room was super small and barely had space to walk around, but in all a good place.

perfect location to visit downtown NY. Time square is right after the corner, central Park 25minutes by walk. everything was as desired. The lady with glasses at the front desk was so kind and helpful. Kudos to her!

The location was close to everything‚Äîliterally steps from Bryant Park and right in the heart of Times Square. It made getting around NYC incredibly easy, whether we were sightseeing, shopping, or grabbing food. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly, and accommodating from check-in to check-out. The room was clean and comfortable, and despite being in such a busy area, it was surprisingly quiet at night. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it for anyone visiting New York City.

Hosts were responsive to original reservation and everything was exactly as they said it would be. Location could not be beat!!! restaurant on premises and very friendly front desk staff!!! We will definitely be back!!!!
I had a decent stay at this hotel and my host was very responsive.. place was very clean and nice.. I‚Äôll surely book again sometime in the future and all recommend it to friends..

Great facilities and an awesome location! It's a block away from Times Square and Bryant Park. We took the Hop-on Hop-off bus right outside the hotel and the Newark Express to Newark Airport in front of Bryant Park. You can walk to most NYC attractions from there. In the lobby is Paul's on Times Square restaurant, which has great food and service. We went to NYC for my father's birthday, and he was amazed by the hotel.

My stay at the hotel was great. It is located just steps away from the most popular clothing stores, such as Zara and H&M, very close to Bryant Park, and only a short walk from Times Square. Truly a perfect location to visit the city‚Äôs iconic spots without the need to take a taxi or public transportation. The room met my expectations, and the service I received at the front desk was appropriate.

If you‚Äôre looking for basic room and amenities in the center of NYC‚Äôs Times Square, Hilton Garden Inn is a great place to stay. The price is right and it‚Äôs a walking distance from a lot of touristic attractions. I prefer a quieter location with more amenities for an extra price per night. But this was perfect because it was a walking distance from my conference.
My stay in NY was amazing, big part thanks to hotel staff! They were all very supportive, helpful, kind and so good in what they are doing that i was amazed! thanks to all!

The Hilton Garden Inn was a wonderful hotel and I would definitely stay there again. The staff was amazing and our Airbnb host. Jason was extremely accommodating and very helpful with any questions we had.

The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. The cleaning staff was super attentive and made sure we had what we needed. Check in was simple and the free coffee was so good. Everything was walking distance and near transportation. I would definitely rebook with them.

The hotel was in the best location, close to the subway, walking distance to the middle of Times Square and the best food places all within walking distance. Hotel staff were so great! I would definitely stay here again! Jason was very responsive to any messages and very helpful!

The hotel lobby and room were well maintained and the staff was friendly and helpful. My room on the 27th floor was surprisingly quiet given the location and the bed was comfortable. The hotel is in a great location and was really close to Bryant Street Park and the subway system.
Amazing location! Perfect for getting around the city. Rooms are small but that‚Äôs NYC, and everything was extremely clean. Will definitely consider staying again next time!

We had a wonderful stay at Hilton Garden Suites Times Square Central! The staff was friendly, welcoming, and always helpful, which made our trip even more enjoyable. The location is perfect‚Äîright in the heart of Times Square, making it easy to walk to Broadway shows, great restaurants, and subway stations. The room was clean, comfortable, and had everything we needed for a convenient stay in New York City. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a central spot with excellent service!
Great place to stay! Staff was very friendly and gave great recommendations. Lovely restaurant in the lobby and beautiful room + view.
Great location right in Times Square! Easy check in, beautiful views, & fantastic service! Thank you will come again.
I had a great stay. Beautiful views very clean and very clear instructions for check in and check out. I will be booking again in the future !
Everything was as advertised and the location was extremely convenient for all the Christmas markets, Broadway shows, and New York landmarks.
Hotel was in a great location, literally steps away from Times Square and close to the subway! My husband and I had a great time and we will be back!!
Amazing location. The check in process was very smooth even with a very long queue. The staff were very helpful with all my queries.
Great stay! The shower was incredible! Quiet, Friendly, efficient, held our bags for no charge. Perfect everything.
Centric place to stay at, close to the metro which made it so much easier to move around . I would stay here again 100%

On a solo weekend trip (and as a former New Yorker who knows NYC fairly well), I chose this hotel for its central location and walkability, cleanliness, safety, and a good night's sleep. It's in an excellent location right by the Times Square train station with access to a million lines to take you anywhere, a quick walk to/from Penn Station train station (as I'd be taking the NJ Transit from Newark airport), and a quick walk to Broadway shows and many key NYC sites like Empire, Rockefeller, Bryant Park, etc. As it's in a central busy location with Times Square's constant bright lights, I always felt safe walking back by myself even at 2am. There is always a security guard at the front door too. This is a no frills not super fancy place, but is excellent for a reliable clean room, unbeatable location, safe area for solo traveler, and quiet sleep. Lobby staff were great and friendly. You're paying for location here to maximize time spent out in NYC, not a luxurious hotel stay.
We enjoyed our stay! This was a great hotel room. The room was small but not abnormal for hotels in the area. This was a good home away from home. I would stay here again.

The host is not actually the hotel itself, but an intermediary on Airbnb. When we arrived at the hotel, the hotel had not received the reservation details, and together with the hotel manager Joe. we had to reach out to the host to obtain the required information. The whole process lasted about an hour or so. Joe the hotel manager was very helpful and understanding, and treated us very well while we had to wait to sort this out. Other than that, all was great, the location especially is hard to beat. The price was much higher than normal though, due to the dates (during UNGA80). All in all, a great place to stay, and we would stay again.

To be at walking distance from the majority of the places I visited in NYC, plus being able to have a well rested sleep at the Hilton Times Square, was an awesome mini-vacay I‚Äôd to all over again and again.

I had an amazing stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in NYC! The location was perfect ‚Äî close to major attractions, subway stations, and plenty of restaurants. The room was spotless, comfortable, and quiet, which made it easy to relax after a long day exploring the city. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, always greeting me with a smile and quick to answer questions or offer recommendations. The amenities, including the mini-fridge, coffee maker, and comfortable bed, made the stay even better. Everything about my experience was smooth and pleasant ‚Äî from check-in to check-out. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting New York City!

Good location for a few days in NYC. Walkable, close to the subway, doors lock at 11 ensuring guest safety (can use room card to get in), complementary coffee and tea in the mornings, gym, laundry, $10 credit for snacks. Downsides include previous guests belongings left in room including dirty socks and a bag of medication and fridge did not work. Overall, not a bad place to stay to visit and explore.

My mom and I came to NYC for some Broadway shows! The location was perfect for that. We loved being able to walk to everything. We were able to drop our bags off before check in. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The host was helpful and responsive. We would definitely stay again next time we come to NYC.

Great location and the staff was very friendly and helpful. They were very patient with explaining the fees that you are paying such as destination fees and making sure that we were all good to go when checking in. I really appreciate the staff holding our bags before and after check-in. It really made our trip so much more comfortable and easier. Thank you again and we hope to stay here again.

HGI has an amazing walkable location. Blocks away from Times Square, Joe‚Äôs Pizza, and plenty of subway entrances. We had an amazing time and will most definitely be back again! We had great service at the hotel and the ability to check our bags the last day while we explored before our flight was so convenient. There is so much to do near this hotel. We will be back again for sure

The location is great. Just beside Times Square metro station, and a few blocks from the best Broadway theaters. The hospitality services are very good, and they have some complimentary goods for the guests that make the stay even more comfortable. The room services are made every day, keeping the room always clean and well organized. A very good choice for a fair cost-benefit stay at the Times Square area.

The Hilton garden Inn was incredible, it is really near to Times Square, and others importants attractions on NYC such as Rockefeller center and public library, the room is a little be small but it is perfect to rest after a long day, it's very quiet and comfortably. The hotel has in the lobby an store that is good for a little snack of beverage.

This hotel is centrally located at Times Square, it had all the amenities I wanted like a fridge and microwave, was very clean and the staff were super friendly. I will definitely stay here again!! The price was good as well -- my brother stayed in Harlem at a hotel that was 2x the price and didn't even have a fridge!

We planned a trip to NYC to go to Broadway and see some shows. This Hilton is perfectly situated and close to everything. It was under renovation, but our room was fine. The bed was comfy, there was hot water and plenty of towels. Aside from that we were out the door every day. One nice thing they did was hold our luggage after the last play we saw, before we headed out of town. Really appreciated that!
Great stay if you want to be in the middle of the city. Times Square was literally just steps away. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.
Fabulous room, close to everything and the staff was highly attentive
Excellent. Clean. Well located. Helpful staff. Fairly priced.
Great stay! Close to everything, check in and checkout was easy, we enjoyed our time!
The location is perfect close to everything. You can walk to about everything you needed.
Location is amazing, walking distance to multiple subway lines. Check in was very smooth and the hotel is able to hold luggage before check in/after check out.
Very worn down. Unwelcoming reception, old and does not match pictures Not worth the money paid
Really great place to stay. Right in the city and the employees are all very friendly. I felt very safe staying there alone! Will keep this in mind if I go back!!
Absolutely loved the location. Was dead center to everything. Subway was only a 2 minute walk. Definitely recommend this hotel.
Had a great stay at the Hilton, staff is very friendly and accommodating. Great location just five minutes from time square
Great place. Perfect location. Trains nearby and walkable to many restaurants, shopping and broadway shows. Would definitely stay there again.
Great hotel! Very friendly staff and in a great location and in walking distance to a lot of attractions!
Excellent location! absolutely enjoyed my stay. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were comfortable.
Everything was nice here, comfortable bed, issue with water coming out into bathroom when showering, however once reported it was fixed.

We loved this hotel!!! It was so clean and in a perfect spot, right by Tmes Square. The price was great, the room was super nice with a standup shower. We didn't experience any "city noise" and the staff was a delight. We will definitely be booking again when we stay in the city!

Hilton Garden Inn Times Square Central 42nd street is at a very convenient location to reach what NY Times Square has to offer. The staff members were very attentive and helpful. We are very happy for our stay at this location and recommend this place as a top of the list lodging alternative.

The host along with all of the staff were amazing. The location was ideal and close to everything. The room was super clean and the hotel staff were attentive. I slept well in the bed and the smart tv was appreciated.

Super convenient spot in time square. Rooms with all necessary electronics appliances such as microwave, coffee maker, and frig. People are so very friendly and responsive! Super good daily credit for water and laundry. Free Starbucks everyday is awesome!
Clean, well kept. Friendly!!!! Amazing location.
This is a great place to stay and it‚Äôs right next to the Square.
Great location! Would book this place again!
Excellent location! Will be staying here again!
Awesome place to stay. Everything in the description is correct. Thanks
Great location, friendly staff. Will book again for my next NY trip.
All Good, but it‚Äôs been 15 days al ready and i haven‚Äôt got my deposit back. Can some one help me?

It came as a surprise that my room was not made after the first day. Upon asking, I was informed it was every second day. I was also charged an additional $94.76 which was not specified when I booked. Including "destination charge" (what was that for??) and four different line items of City Tax. The Destination Charge is a hidden fee relating to "non-optional" services provided at the property. It was non-avoidable, and a should have been part of the booking rate. Very sneaky and unethical of Hilton to operate this way.
Excellent place to stay due to its location
Perfect location! Close to everything! Enjoyed our stay!
Great stay just steps away from Times Square!
Good place to stay and in a good location near Times Square
staff and location were perfect
Great place to stay highly recommend
Great location, close to everything.

We went to work in the city and rented it for our team. Excellent location, great amenities, very good bed. The hotel allows you to leave your luggage in the lobby, which was very important for our departure and arrival. Cleaning is available every day and free Starbucks coffee in the lobby daily. We highly recommend this place! Translated from Portuguese Show original
Great stay - highly recommend & will return again in the future.
Great location to Times Square. Clean. Beautiful hotel.
Good location, decent size and cleanliness.
The 4 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn Times Square Central were perfect.
Excellent location and all services neede
Great location. The staff was helpful and nice coffee.
Great location! Enjoyed my stay very much!
We love the Hilton Garden Inn. Great location, wonderful & attentive staff. Our top choice to stay in New York!
Great location in between Times Square and Bryant Park. Easy check in and spacious room by NYC standards
Great location to stay the host the staff and room were great! If you‚Äôre visiting Central NY this the place to be. Everything within walking distance.
Great stay. Nice accommodations, great location, the internet worked fine in my laptop so I could work during the week

7 years on Airbnb Rating, 1 star , ¬∑ May 2025 I have given this hotel one star because of being charged twice for taxes. The hotel itself was good, great area, quite for location, clean bathroom so no complaints there. Negatives were common areas etc need refurbishment but this is of reflected in the price paid. Only 3 elevators for 36 floors and one was out for the whole 8 nights of our stay. Wait times were ok but can be extended in busy periods. Staff were friendly and room serviced daily by a lovely lady. My issue is all taxes and charges were paid to Airbnb except for the destination charge which was to be paid to the hotel. As checkout was busy express checkout was suggested with the invoice emailed. Upon receipt I had been charged the destination charge plus local taxes that had already been paid. No amount of phone calls to the hotel or Airbnb has reversed this mistake of US$308. Clearly both companies have no idea what their process is. Other reviews seems to replicate my experience. Don‚Äôt book on Airbnb is my advice.

we stayed six nights for our first visit to NYC. The quick and frequent bus connection (less than half an hour to Times Square) was very comfortable. Easy check in & out. It was nice to have to have our luggage stored after checkout. Further out from Times Square but maybe a good thing because it might have been noisier. The hotel is definitely in a good location, you‚Äôre not in a crowded area but you also aren‚Äôt far from times square. 10/10 experience. Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It‚Äôs well located, the staff was kind and helpful, and the overall experience was great. I‚Äôd definitely stay here again whenever I‚Äôm back.

This building truly stands out as one of the best places to stay in New York. The views are absolutely stunning‚Äîwhether day or night, they capture the beauty and energy of the city perfectly. The location of Yotel is perfect to get around to anywhere you need to go in NY,NY. The room could use updating. The shower and toilet could have been cleaner. Great location and the room was clean. Only thing was they did not have a microwave and the ice machine didn‚Äôt work. The hotel is a great walking distance to a lot of places!

We thoroughly enjoyed our 1 night ‚Äúpre-cruise‚Äù stay. Super clean and comfortable. Staff was excellent. Room is very small and minimalistic yet functional. Great location and walkable to so much around Times Square, including the subway system. The Yobot, automated robot, for baggage wasn't working when we needed it so we had to pay three dollars per bag to store it for the day.
