Also the neighbourhood is alright, had no problems walking alone at night (although some company would have made me feel safer, but that‚Äôs a me thing). What made me very happy to have booked there was how friendly and helpful Trenton was. I don‚Äôt think you‚Äòll find a better AirBnB for this price range. Would come again.

I had a great time at Trenton's place. Everything was as described in the listing. Overall it is a good value for the price, and a great place to crash after a long day visiting New-York. Trenton was very helpful as well. The place is very well located, with multiple subway lines that go downtown. Also I didn't have any issues walking around the neighborhood, even alone after 10pm.

Trenton was a wonderful host! He was helpful, flexible and responsive. The room was basic and was in an urban setting. The area had typical NYC noises, it‚Äôs not a quiet neighborhood. And It‚Äôs not the Ritz-Carleton, but it‚Äôs an affordable night stay in NYC. Public transportation is very close and It‚Äôs an easy bus ride to LGA.

I had a great stay at Trenton‚Äôs place! The apartment was very clean, quiet, and comfortable ‚Äî a rare find in Manhattan. It was an incredible value for the location, and Trenton was kind and helpful throughout my stay. I would absolutely recommend his place to anyone looking for an affordable and pleasant stay in NYC.

Trenton is a great (great) host, kind and accomodating ü´∂ He gave me amazing recommendations for nearby places. To all my dear French, this is a good listing to spend sleeping and exploring New York during the day; for cheap in Manhattan, so close to everything! üóΩ Regarding the neighborhood, mind your own business and it should be okay Translated from English Show original

Trenton is an amazing host! He‚Äôs super friendly, gave very clear instructions on how to use the keys, etc. he also shared a code for food delivery which was delicious and a huge money saver! He also let me leave mu suitcase after checkout, as I had a late evening flight. The place is close to subway and only 20 minutes to manhattan. Would definitely recommend Trenton and his place!

Trenton is very friendly. I felt guilty that I didn‚Äôt get the chance to have a proper conversation. Until the last hour where Trenton kindly let me check out late while I waited for my Lyft. This place does exactly what it says on the tin! If you want High Society living in New York, Harlem is not the place. This is a real neighbourhood though and as long as you keep your head down it is perfectly safe. Trenton‚Äôs place is perfect for a single traveller looking for a cheap stay and just wants a bed and bathroom. Very responsive and helpful on check-in. I think it was almost 1am by the time I arrived and I was shattered. He was perfectly happy for me to go straight to my room, even helping with my luggage! I think I am done with New York, this was my 3rd visit. But if I do I would definitely look to book Trenton again! Thanks for your hospitality üëçüèª
Trenton was a great host. He was very helpful and communicative, and was able to accommodate to my plans. Would stay again

Trenton was a great host. He was flexible and proactive with excellent communication and was also friendly. Everything was as described and I had a comfortable stay. I‚Äôd definitely return in the future.
Trenton‚Äôs place was perfect for my solo NYC trip! Great host, gave a few suggestions but otherwise left me to my own devices. Very responsive on messages and great location for the subway stop

Trenton is a great host. Easy to talk to and super communicative. Place is exactly as shown in the photos. It‚Äôs a decent walk to the subway line. Lots of great Harlem restaurants and deli‚Äôs close by. Noise may be an issue for you as there is a train line close to the place, but I managed to sleep through it fine. The room was very comfortable. All in all, I would stay here again. You‚Äôll need to commute a little to get to Midtown, but it‚Äôs still a nice option.

If you are a solo traveller, Trenton's space is an affordable and comfortable choice. Close to the subway, so transportation is seamless. Trenton is a good host and access to and from the building is easy.
Great stay for a few days in the City. Super easy to get to from LGA. Subway was close. Quite street. Very comfortable room. Trenton was very helpful and friendly. Will look to stay here again!!

Great place for the price, felt like crashing at a friend's place for a couple nights. Trenton was great about checking in to make sure I was comfortable - friendly and attentive but not at all nosey! Grocery stores, cafes, and subway access super close by. Felt safe my entire stay.

The hotel has an amazing location and a great team. I‚Äôm a flight attendant so I‚Äôm very familiar with the chain and the customer service is great. The only little thing was the elevator, it really took us a long time every time we wanted to go down but besides that everything was amazing. Thank you so much!

This hotel is in a perfect location to walk to both time square, Rockefeller Center & Empire State Building. You have free breakfast and around the clock, hot tea and coffee. Steps away from the hotel there is a 7-Eleven to pick up anything that you need and pretty good pizza on the corner. If you walk the other way, there is a bagel place that has like 25 different types of cream cheese.

Place is what you pay for it‚Äôs not bad but could use some improvements, tv was good. The bed was done and no trash around the room/hotel but somethings need extra wiping down and the elevator and some things are a little janky. Breakfast selection was nice and everything else in the hotel is straightforward. For a good price it‚Äôs okay.

This was my first stay in NYC, and I was very nervous, especially when I found such a low priced hotel in a perfect location. Great deal, super friendly staff from the airbnb hosts - on site, clear check in and out, breakfast was delicious, valet parking was convenient and quick, and they even texted me after check in to make sure everything was okay with the room. My boyfriend & I will definitely be back!

I was hesitant to book this room because I thought it was strange to book a hotel room through Airbnb, but it worked out fine! The room was messy (some hair and mold in the bathroom, bed unmade when we arrived) but if you‚Äôre just looking for a place to sleep and don‚Äôt plan on spending much time in the room while visiting NY, it‚Äôll do the job. It was a great deal, so I‚Äôd stay again for a short trip.

I feel like we lucked out with this stay! When looking for a hotel I was seeing extremely high prices, until I came along this gem. A good location with super simple check in. In fact we were actually able to check in several hours early which was so helpful! A very responsive host as well.. only complaint is the conditioner bottle in the shower was empty. Would highly recommend!

Superb customer service, from the front desk to the breakfast staff. So accommodating, helpful, kind and respectful. the hotel itself is in a great location.. my daughter and I loved staying here. they let us store our luggage so we could enjoy the day in the city before our flight left. a huge thank you to the entire hotel staff!!

No real complaints. Clean hotel, easy access to subway, kind employees. We did not partake in the continental breakfast so I cannot speak to that. Neighborhood seemed fine. Square Pizza across the street is great for a late night slice and the Joyce Public House restaurant and bar a few businesses down had great food with very reasonable prices.

The hotel was exactly like pictures. It was clean and in a great location of Manhattan! We easily walked to many different restaurants and activities. It‚Äôs also not far from multiple subway stations for easy access to that as well. Manager would text in to see how the stay was and brought us extra towels quickly at our request. He followed up to ensure we had everything we needed multiple times. It was a great stay!

We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn Midtown Manhattan/Times Square. The location was super easy to get to from JFK and perfect for walking everywhere. We were able to explore so much of the city without constantly needing transportation. If you want convenience, comfort, and a prime spot for sightseeing, this is a great choice!

Location was perfect close to many attractions and restaurants. Staff was quick to respond to any issues we had (like lack of hot water, toiletries). One major set back was elevator service, specially during morning breakfast as they only had two and at times only one was working. One day my boyfriend went up the stairs (to 21st floor) since he had waited over 20 minutes during breakfast. This is not ideal for anyone!

Great stay from start to end. They were gracious enough to allow us to check in at 11:30am, were very friendly and answered any questions we had, and even held onto our luggage after we checked out. Great location, wonderful staff, and honestly just a great hotel over all, especially for the price. Even the bed was nice. Great job - excited to stay again!

Perfect location for a short stay. Location is excellent for walkability- close to Hell‚Äôs Kitchen/restaurant row, Times Square, and subway access. The space itself is small but clean and comfortable. We weren‚Äôt concerned with space size because we were there to explore. Hotel staff is professional and courteous, host is communicative and friendly. Would definitely stay here again!

Excellent pricing for what you get. Typical hotel but not high end. Def could use some renovations and upgrades but the room was clean and halls were quiet. The receptionist had great attitudes. Great location.

You are right by the elevator so you can constantly hear it going up and down. The bathroom was pretty dirty. Overall you pay for what you get! If you want a cheap reliable place this is the one for you. Host doesn‚Äôt communicate much.

We stayed four nights and the location was very convenient for touristy activities. The bed was comfy and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is showing it's age a little and is probably due for a refresh, but we'd probably stay again.

The hotel had everything we needed for a weekend away, including an amazing free breakfast and tasty cookies in the evening! The front staff were kind and responsive. The location is great, close enough to walk to/from the train station, shows, shopping, etc!
Great hotel. Nicely priced for its location and services. Only downside is the elevator. Prepare to spend 10mins or more waiting. Otherwise, I had a great say and its a wonderful location.
The staff was very friendly and able to assist with all our needs. Close to Times Square and the Garment District. Very easy to get in and out. Would highly recommend and the free breakfast, amazing!

I think that this is definitely a steal for the price. You‚Äôre literally right in the middle of all of the tourist stuff. The hosts communicated extremely fast and were kind. I liked that the room was straightened up everyday.

The Airbnb was in a great location and walkable to Times Square and multiple subway stations. It was easy to check in and host answered quickly. The rooms were pretty small but the free breakfast made up for it.

10 years on Airbnb Rating, 4 stars , ¬∑ January 2026 Great place to stay if you want to get around the city conveniently. Breakfast was okay. There were only 2 working elevators that will take ages for you to get in and staff are not that friendly.

This place was great! Very walkable to all the ‚Äútourist-y‚Äù parts of NYC. Check-in/check-out was very easy and hotel staff were very helpful. We took advantage of the valet parking and concierge service, and it was wonderful. Great price for a busy holiday weekend. Would definitely stay here again!

My friend and I stayed for one night and the room was really comfortable and clean. The hotel was in a nice location, close to a lot of nice stores and restaurants. Time square is in walking distance. The host is very kind and responds quickly!!
The room we stayed at was very specious for me. It was clean and well maintained. The hosts were very responsive and helpful. I will definitely be staying here when I come back to NY.

My daughter & I stayed in The Hampton Inn on W 39th St. Friday through Monday. Excellent service, delicious breakfast each morning, and location was within 15-20 mins of all the highlights of NYC. Very reasonable priced

I would not stay here again. although the location was great and the price not too unreasonable, we were given a room with two full beds when we booked a king and nobody could remedy it for us. further, one of the bed sheets had a hole the size of a doorknob in it and we had to ask for a hair dryer and coffee pods because they were not provided. last, the elevator service was so poor that there were often patrons lined up waiting for several elevator runs before they could board.

The accommodations were clean and adequate but not very fancy. The bathroom shower was small and in need of some minor fixes. The free breakfast was very good and the staff was friendly. One of the elevators kept breaking down and since there were only two that meant a long wait at times which wasn‚Äôt as big a deal for us on the 5th floor but a big problem for those above us. However, the location was great. We could walk to everything and for the price relative to other hotels in the area it was what you would expect

Great location. Very close to the subway entrance. Enjoyed the king bed. Communication was great, and the hotel staff was very responsive. The free breakfast was a great bonus. Would absolutely stay here again.

Good team of people who did a great job with what they have to work with. Great location in midtown which made many of our activities very accessible. They kept things clean and the breakfast team was very accommodating.
Perfect place to just stop, drop, and go out and explore NYC. We were placed next to the elevators so it was bit noisy. But we slept right through it! Perfectly placed and close to everything!

Great location. Close to Times Square and wide variety of restaurants. Always felt safe. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Hosts were responsive and helpful. I will definitely look for Times Square South when visiting New York again!
For this busy time of year, this place was worth the money based on location, convenience and the staff was extremely welcoming and accommodating! I would book it again.üòò
The elevators were pretty slow and sometimes there was a long line but thankfully we were on the 5th floor and able to take stairs easily. Other than that stay was great and location was good!
great value for money! especially appreciated the free breakfast :) only issue was that the elevator went out at one point and i was on the 19th floor so it was a bit of an inconvenience

I enjoyed my stay here. It was easily accessible and very close to attraction sites. The host was very proactive in reaching out to me to see if I was settling in ok. The staff were also very friendly and helpful. The only problem was that the hot water in the bathroom wasn‚Äôt running as it should, however, after calling the front desk, it was fixed for the night but stopped again at dawn. I had to leave because of an early morning flight, so I didn‚Äôt call again. That notwithstanding, I‚Äôd definitely recommend this place.

stayed here and had a really great experience! the front desk and staff were super sweet and the room was clean. they also were willing to hold our bags before and after checking in/out! can‚Äôt ask for much more. one of the only issues was that the shower leaked a LOT, like water all over the floor, but honestly who cares. for the price it was more than worth it. i feel that anyone complaining about the room size or something similar were expecting well beyond their means. stay here if you want a good experience for a really decent price (especially in NYC!)
Out of all the places I‚Äôve stayed in NY, this has to be my fave so far. From the hotel staff to the location, everything was phenomenal. I cannot wait to stay here again.
If you're looking for a place to stay that is on the cheaper end of NY hotels but is still nice, look no further. Clean rooms, nice and helpful staff, and breakfast included.
I really loved the experience of staying here. The location is amazing, few blocks from time square, the stuff was super kind and the room was comfortable. I would definitely come back

Great location, lots to do in a walkable distance, very close to Hudson Yards, good food options, and access to the trains. We had an issue with our first room and the staff took care of it right away. The host was super accommodating, friendly, and responsive. A solid place to stay.

Our stay in NYC was great. Communication with Jason was quick, friendly, and helpful. The Hotel is walking distance to many places to visit around Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, and even the High Line Park. Subway was easily accessible to get to further places to see.

Convenient location. Water temperature in bathroom was difficult, if not impossible, to control. Lights in elevator were flickering constantly. Otherwise, room was clean and a good value for Midtown Manhattan.

I had a wonderful stay at the Hampton by Hilton on West 39th Street! The location is perfect for exploring New York City, everything is close and easy to reach. The room was spotless, the bed was very comfortable, and the staff were warm, friendly, and always ready to help. Breakfast was a great bonus, and the overall atmosphere felt safe, welcoming, and well organized. I truly enjoyed my stay and would definitely choose this hotel again.

The location of this hotel was great. Right next to the Port Authority, which is access to bus to EWR, and all the major subway lines. Walking to Garment District (MOOD), Theater District, Times Square, Rockefeller, Radio City Music etc. This hotel was just fine with a nice breakfast and friendly helpful staff.

Really good host very responsive, free breakfast which included pancakes, bagels, eggs, sausages etc. The only thing was the cleanliness of the room and the hotel itself. The bathroom could do with a little refurb as there was bits of wall crumbing. There is also only 2 lifts in the hotel which can get extremely busy meaning you might have to use the stairs instead as we ended up waiting 10min for a space in the lift.

The location was good , convenient, close to entertainments. The room was clean and comfy. Breakfast was simple but available. I would advise to go earlier because it got very busy close to 8:00 am. My only thing I didn‚Äôt like was very busy elevators and you have to stay in line to get to your floor. Otherwise my stay was pleasant .

Location was as expected & good for our purposes. Staff were pleasant. Perhaps some of what I was disappointed in was listed (very small room & no log in access to streaming on tv) but other aspects of room & hotel were dissatisfying: shower was moldy & the drain cover was missing, very small elevators causing very long waits to use, breakfast was chaotic so we didn‚Äôt take advantage of it, hallways & stairwell were not clean.

Very comfortable and helpful. They let us check in early and always answered our questions. This hotel is a walking distance to everything we wanted to do! I will definitely be booking again. The only thing I have to say was the bathtub floor was dirty and didn‚Äôt feel too sanitary but everything else was perf.

Perfect location just minutes walk from the time square and metro. This place is quite convenient, just a short walk from Times Square and the metro. It‚Äôs easy to access a variety of restaurants, shops, and all the usual attractions in the area. A decent spot if you're looking to be close to the action without being right in the middle of it.

The location is great for visiting Time Square and popular pizza/bagels spots - Joe's, Liberty Bagel, PopUp Bagel - to name a few. In addition, the staff are all friendly and helpful, especially when it came to early check in and storing our bags. We were specifically looking for a clean place to stay as NYC is known to be dirty and/or outdated, and this hotel was spotless. For our first time in NYC, we're glad we stayed here!

I really enjoyed my stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square. The location was perfect, and the breakfast provided each morning was a highlight. Cesar was exceptional, he brought so much energy and warmth to the breakfast experience, making it one of my favorite parts of the stay. Rooms were standard, clean, and stocked üôèüèº

We were so impressed with our stay! Our room was super clean. The bed and linens were really comfy, too. I was most relieved about the mirrors and lighting in the bathroom! It made getting ready to go out a breeze. The staff was really responsive and checked in multiple times to make sure we had everything we needed. I would definitely stay again.

We had an amazing stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square! The room was cozy, and the location couldn‚Äôt be better, right in the heart of Times Square with everything easily accessible. The service was exceptional, and the host & the staff were incredibly responsive, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable stay. I highly recommend this place for anyone visiting NYC!

This was a great experience, as it was a regular hotel room with all the usual amenities close to Time Square (but not too close). The rate was amazing (including American Breakfast with omelette, sausage, fried potatoes)! Waffles were served by the amazing and very friendly breakfast staff.
Besides first going to the Times Square location from the train station, walking by 39th on the way, in below zero wind chill, we enjoyed ourselves! My bad, girlfriend forgave me.

Great place. Close to Times Square and many food options available including quick food and sit down options, we stayed one day and a night, very clean and comfortable. The only downside I was a little disappointed when I learned that we couldn‚Äôt make the waffles ourselves. Normally that decision wouldn‚Äôt bother me but the lady who was making them was cleaning and walking around at the same time which I appreciate bc she‚Äôs keeping it clean but she was wearing a mask that wasn‚Äôt coving her nose and she repeatedly coughed into her ungloved hand and didn‚Äôt sanitize them before taking the food off the burner. That absolutely canceled the point of the mask and the point of not having hundreds of hands touching the maker.

I gave this 4 stars only because it didnt include a microeave in the room and a place to wash clothes. However theres a microwave downstairs and a laundrymat a block away. The room was clean and matched the description, my host kept in contact with me throughout the trip. The free breakfast is one of the best parts of the trip, NY food can be expensive and this helps with the prices a little by providing you a big breakfast. A thing to keep in mind is this hotel is in times square but if your thinking about the main plaza like one times sqaure, your going to have to walk a couple blocks. If you able bodied its not that bad of a walk and there are lots of things close by like broadway. I recommend getting this hotel.

The Hampton is located just a block or so off Times Square. This made getting around New York as easy as it can be. The staff were always friendly and the room was tidy and cleaned daily during my stay. You could tell my particular room had sustained water damage and some point and has never been properly repaired. The entire room sloped towards the outside of the building so much so that the shower pan wouldn‚Äôt drain correctly and the door on the wardrobe wouldn‚Äôt stay open. The TV was also very dated and the cable cut in and out frequently. If you want a room that‚Äôs convenient it is that, otherwise it‚Äôs not worth the price as they do not do any repairs or updates with the amenities.

Overall, the hotel was moderately clean and the staff were professional and kind. However, there were several issues that made the stay frustrating. There were only two elevators in the entire hotel for both guests and staff, which caused long delays. We stayed on the 15th floor and ended up walking down all 15 flights of stairs with our luggage so we wouldn‚Äôt miss our flight. We called the elevator three times, and each time the wait was at least 5 to 10 minutes, and the elevators were completely full. While the hotel was affordable, I would not stay here again. The room temperature was also very uncomfortable, constantly switching between unbearably hot and unbearably cold.

The airbnb host Quinn was always responsive and gave answers to my question. Jessica at the front desk went above & beyond giving directions and suggestions. The door person found a taxi cheaper than Lyft getting there. Wonderful place to stay!

Dirty rugs, noisy place, mirrors disfigured, bed linens with black lint throughout, safe didn't work (wouldn't lock), no cookies at 3 pm - 5pm as promised, dirty elevators. TV not programed with time nor date. The owners need to remodel, do upgrades. I know this is a busy Hampton Inn due to the location of Times Square, but you can do remodeling floor by floor until completed. Only lose a few bucks spread out over time and happier guests. I've owned 2 businesses and this is not the ideal way to satisfy a guest/client. I will never stay here again; not up to my cleanliness standards. Highlights: The breakfast guy is helpful and cheery housekeeping did an great job. Check in & out easy.
The stay was pleasant. The elevator wasn't working on Saturday morning, but they had a technician who was on site and operated it manually so we could get to our appointment without delay.

such a great hotel that‚Äôs close to ALL of the touristy things! Times Square, Central Park, Liberty Bagels, and just a short Subway ride from the financial district. Easy to navigate and off in a slightly more slow street which was nice for sleeping at night.

It was all about convenience for me and needed to be in the center of attractions and this place nailed the spot. I was very satisfied. The rooms were clean. Staff was friendly. Breakfast was, just OK. But overall, my trip was a success.
As someone who has never been to New York City before, I thought it was easy to find, it was clean, and it was close to everything to we could walk. Staff was also very friendly

As a solo female traveller I felt safe and accommodated. Staff was friendly and helpful. It is mid-town so do not expect a big hotel but everything was clean, bed was comfortable and the buffet was perfect!

Loved this stay. I normally prefer apts. and less hotels. But in this case, the room was great. The Location was great. Free breakfast every day and 27/4 tea and coffee stations which was perfect for me as I caught a cold! Such good value for money. A big LIKE.

This place was fine. And that what I would call it. Good location, nice staff, the place is mostly clean.(dirty under the mattress but the sheets were clean which is what counts) But it is a cheaper place to stay. So you pay for what you get. It gets the job done.

Place is as described. Rooms are small but clean. Location is great. Right in the middle of Times Square and walkable to most places. Elevator wait times is a real problem. But if you are patient and ignore that, it‚Äôs not too bad. Breakfast is okay.

The hotel is close to everything that you would want. -time square -restaurants -shopping -subway stations Just make sure you prepare some place to park before you go. Room was comfy and was cleaned daily. If you are looking for views this is not the place

This was a perfect place to stay in Midtown. The property was off the strip so we didn‚Äôt hear any noise. The area was very safe and a 20 minute walk to everything. The hosts checked in with me to make sure our stay was going well. Would definitely stay here again. Thank you.

A nice place to stay if you are just looking for somewhere to rest and get ready at. Pretty small but it worked for our weekend. We were able to check-in early without requesting an early check-in and staff were nice. Elevators took a long time and had broken lights. The room was fine including a king size bed and mini fridge. The water in the shower backed up and the floor was a little dirty. Walking distance to Hell's Kitchen, Theater District, Time Square, and more. The street itself was a little run down but easy to get to other parts of the city.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è 5/5 ‚Äî Perfect Manhattan Stay! Our stay at this Airbnb in New York City was absolutely amazing! The apartment was spotless ‚Äî super clean, modern, and comfortable. The location couldn‚Äôt have been better ‚Äî right in Manhattan and walking distance to so many great restaurants, shops, and attractions. It was incredibly convenient for exploring the city, and everything we needed was close by. Check-in was smooth, and the host was friendly and responsive. We couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better place to stay ‚Äî definitely recommend it to anyone visiting New York!

For my first visit to NYC, the location of the room was perfect. It was close to a subway and I was able to walk to Broadway for two shows, Times Square, and Macy‚Äôs. A little further walk to Central Park. I was able to get sound sleep with the room being quiet and with a comfortable and clean bed.

Because I had booked two separate rooms, and used my name on both, the desk could not locate the second room upon arrival in their system. Instead of a hassle, the clerk person found the glitch between AirBnB and their system, and rectified everything efficiently and swiftly. Throughout our two-day stay, we found the personnel to be exceptionally friendly and helpful with bags and information. The location, near 39th and 9th Avenue, was just right for our needs. Thanks for making our stay pleasant.

Although small the hotel Is in a great location, the staff was friendly and attentive! The only issue I had was that our room was close by the elevator and we heard all the noise. Otherwise it was clean and close to all the NYC attractions! We‚Äôd defiantly book again.

The staff here were great, the room was nice, the location was great. Only thing we didn‚Äôt like was the curtain in our room didn‚Äôt fully close. From out side looking up at our room, it appeared there were only a few rooms that had our issue possibly. The curtain mount itself didn‚Äôt allow for it to close and the apartments directly across from us could see right in. Also the only ice machine that worked was in the basement. Other than that we enjoyed our stay.

I had a terrible experience. The rooms smelled bad, the towels were extremely foul-smelling to the point that it was disgusting to dry myself with them, and my sheets had yellow stains and even blood ‚Äî yes, blood. This is absolutely unacceptable! On top of that, at check-in I was told there would be a $150 fee held until check-out and that it would be refunded instantly. However, when I checked out, I was informed that it actually takes five business days for the money to be returned. This is nothing but lies and complete disregard for the guest.

This was a great hotel for a solo female traveler. The location was great for getting to lots of areas - Chelsea, upper east & west side, plus the theater district. Lots to do and really nice staff. Would definitely recommend!
We enjoyed our stay at this hotel! The location is super convenient, and this is a great value stay for such an expensive area generally. We would stay here again for sure.

I enjoyed my stay at Times Square South, the room was nice and breakfast was great too, but there‚Äôre some minor things like it doesn‚Äôt have new furniture, it might be old or a bit dirty. But in general it was a good experience.

Everything went very smoothly with check-in. The interface between the hotel and AirBnB was seamless. The front desk staff were welcoming and friendly. The room itself was adequate for our needs. The hotel felt safe. I would stay here again.

This location is poorly maintained. The elevators are super small and the entire lobby area is in need of maintenance and cleaning. The room was ok, but the vents on the AC unit were cloggy and the carpets were gross!

It‚Äôs the Hampton Inn and booking through Airbnb was a lot cheaper than booking through Hilton. Great location for me as I took the bus to Manhattan and the hotel is 3 min walk from Port Authority Bus Terminal. It's also very close to Times Square.

After waiting to get checked in we missed our tour and it was my birthday so it was ruined. The host took a while to respond while dealing with this. There were people everywhere waiting on their room to be cleaned. Once we got our room the mirror had some kind of symbols written on them and they never came to clean it or remove it. The shower floor was missing and hard to stand on. Host was bad and hotel was as well. Now the location is the only thing that was good about it all.

We were on a two day mother/son trip to New York. We saw four shows and walked to Central Park and Times Square. Our stay was exactly what we needed. The hotel was clean and safe and the location could not have been better. We easily walked from the train station to the hotel to drop our bags. The staff were amazing. They were very nice and helpful and kept our bags before we checked in and after we checked out so we did not have to try to drag them through theatres. It was just a great stay. Thank you!

This place was very clean & quiet, nice stay for a couple of days, Times Square just a few blocks away walking distance! Served free breakfast which was a plus! Only thing I wish os that it had some sort of bluetooth or fire stick/cable for TV.. Other than that, i‚Äôd book again!

Very happy with our short stay here. Great location, easily walkable to Broadway shows, etc. We arrived early and were able to check in upon arrival. Front desk attendant was very welcoming! Rooms were clean and comfy.

It is hard to find a better value for money in New York, with hosts who reply in under 10 minutes. The place is clean and spacious, check-in and check-out were smooth, and it‚Äôs definitely a convenient choice for a budget-friendly stay in NYC even though the rooms are elegant.

Location, location, location! This was perfect for our extra night we decided to spend in NYC. Close to Times Square and close to the subway. The room was perfect for just my husband and I. We could see the top of the Empire State Building from our room. Would definitely stay here again.

Great place to stay! The hotel was decent for NYC in size and clean! The view was great!!! The elevators do take a long time sometimes but that is sometimes to be expected. Definitely would book again (:

I was a little bit worried when I saw the reviews about the cleanliness since I am a germaphobe myself but it was spotless. The front desk was super welcoming and polite. The location was perfect and the room was really cozy.

my husband and I planned a one night getaway to NY City. where we stayed was perfect as we could walk pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. It was clean, quiet, and comfortable. we couldn't have asked for more! Thankyou!

I didn't actually get to stay at this hotel. When I arrived, they said they had no rooms and took me to a hostel two doors down. The service was excellent, but then the new hostel overcharged my credit card without informing me. I asked the front desk about it after I noticed that I was being charged for extra cost, and they said it was a mistake and they would refund the money. But I still feel bad.

The room was perfect with in suite bathroom & full length mirror. Very walkable to public transit. Generous complimentary breakfast as this room is located inside a Hampton by Hilton. Only Two elevators to service 32 floors. Wait times are long during morning breakfast and check out.

11 years on Airbnb Rating, 5 stars , ¬∑ August 2025 Lovely comfortable and well presented room. The provision of coffee and biscuits at the check-in were a surprise bonus. The accommodation was very handy to all the main New York attractions- very walkable. I would recommend the hotel for a visit.

Definitely worth it! Great location + great amenities! Comes with free breakfast which is good for the price! Employees were very friendly and very helpful. Highly recommend! Definitely coming back! ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è

10 years on Airbnb Rating, 5 stars , ¬∑ August 2025 Easy walk from Pen Station to this Airbnb. Great location and very quiet which is a surprise for New York City. I enjoyed the late checkout and that I can leave my bags there after checkout. Comfy bed and no issues at all. Would highly recommend for anyone staying in NYC
My stay was delightful. Everything was clean, staff was friendly, and the location was perfect for walking.
A very comfortable place to stay near Times Square! The room was clean and service was amazing!

This was an extra night we had to do, so we had to schedule the extra night through here, but here is the review again: Location was perfect! You are just a block away from the street that will take you directly to times square, also you have one of the main subway stations just a couple of blocks away and everything seems super close. Staff is superfriendly on main desk, on breakfast, cleaning; all of them were super helpful and great; We had to stay an extra night due to a winter storm and they were super helpful to make sure we didn't have any extra inconvenience. Internet is not that great but I managed to have some calls and work a bit from the hotel. Only real drawback we really had was about the elevators. One broke down on the second day so you have to wait a long time to go either up or down during peak hours, and it wasn't fixed in the full 7 extra days we stayed there.

Had a great stay at this location. central for all that NYC has to offer and short walk from times square. Beds are very comfy and rooms are clean and cozy, but the place is very dated. Not worth the price we paid. I have to say that although the guy at breakfast was really nice and cheerful, the breakfast experience was not the best. We were unable to have breakfast on 2 of the days, due to there being to many people and not enough seating. people were taking there food to the rooms if and when they could get to the food. The lifts were broken throughout our stay, with only one lift working. My family had to drag their cases down 7 flights of stairs when we were checking out as the lift that was working was full for over 1 hour so difficult to get in with the amount of people using them. it was stressful. People corrugated outside the lift and the space was only wide enough for one person, made it difficult to assess. Staff were lovely, friendly and professional. made to feel welcome.
Great stay. Easy check in and walkable distance to Times Square. We just needed a place to sleep and shower and this was perfect.
Very nice 3 star hotel. The staff were friendly and super responsive to the couple of issues that we had. The location is excellent. Great value for the price!
Great location, hotel room clean and comfy bed. We had a great stay and would definitely return when next in New York, many thanks
Good hotel for the price! 10 mins from Time Square, lots of good food options, 10 minutes from the Manhattan Center!

While I was very stressed out over the hotel not having our correct reservation due to rebooking issues (I was reassured after my partner informed me people could own hotel rooms in New York üòÖ), eventually the reservation was put in place successfully and we were able to check in with no problem. Traveling can be really stressful and the hosts were communicative and helpful, especially when I was very stressed over our booking. The location is in a wonderful area, reasonable distance between all sight seeing and nearby transportations. There‚Äôs a 20.00 shuttle from the airport to a ten minute walk from the hotel. Thank you to the hosts for their patience and ensuring my reservation was in placed through my travel panic, the stay once the reservation was in place was smooth and wonderful!
Great place and super affordable for the area, you are in walking distance of most things and if you‚Äôre not the subway is down the street
Great stay! Super convenient to Times Square. Everything was as described. No issues at all. Would definitely stay here again.

Nice location, small but cozy room, friendly and helpful staff, I would have given a 5-star review if it were not for what we experienced during the first night. During the stay of our first night, the heating system in the room did not work. The room was too cold to fall asleep in NYC's freezing December. At around 5:00 a.m., I went to the front desk and reported the issue. Later, an engineer confirmed that the heat had broken. We were then transferred to another room. After the transfer, I noticed that there was a clearly installed control panel on the wall for the heating system, while there were only exposed screws at the same place in the previous room. This indicated that the hotel should have already known the failure of the amenity, but they still assigned the room to me. I requested a refund for the first night. So far, the hotel hasn't responded, even after the intervention of Airbnb. Anyway, this might be a good place most of the time, but be aware of the risk.
This was a great location. The room was nice and spacious. Elevator took a long time so try getting rooms on the lower floor. But, overall a really great location.
Nice place. Off the busy section so not too much noise. Easy to walk to everything we wanted to see.
Great location, and solid amenities for the price. Room was clean and as advertised. Would stay here again!
The host at the hotel was awesome she helped a lot with parking as well. Also Cesar who served breakfast in the am was amazing and u can tell he loves his job.
The hotel was amazing! A 10 minute walk to Times Square, and super close to other attractions too! The room was spacious and super clean. Highly recommend!
The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, the staff was helpful! Good price for the location.

Great hotel, great and friendly staff, kind and responsive host. The hotel and location was well worth the money for the NYC/times square experience. Host was very responsive and kind for any questions or concerns. The hotel was clean, nice and the staff was great. Breakfast was just a typical hotel breakfast with amazing waffles with any toppings you‚Äôd like, the hotel staff even made the waffles for us and wrapped it up for us when we wanted to take them up and eat in the room but there was plenty of room in the dining areas to eat as well. As read in other reviews the elevator could be slow at times during breakfast rush, or check in times, but other than that I hardly waited for an elevator and most of the time rode it completely by myself with nobody else inside even during Christmas time. Everything went amazingly and I 10000% recommend this location and host. Thank you so much again! And we will be back for our next trip to Times Square :)

It was exactly as expected. Generally clean hotel room with a king bed, bathroom and mini fridge. We stayed during the Christmas holidays. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They held our bags before check in and after check out so we could walk around without them. The elevators were working perfectly fine despite negative reviews about them. Location is great, on a non busy street but still a 5 min walk to times Square, Bryant Park etc. Was it small? Sure but its a hotel room in NYC I'm not sure why people are expecting spacious - and you aren't there to hang out in the room. Its perfect for changing, sleeping, showering etc. Exactly what you need it for. Only qualm was the toilet was kind of broken. The handle wasnt really working and you had to push down REALLY hard to flush. But I'm sure they will fix that. Also, it isn't fancy by any means and is slightly dated but that doesn't bother us. But I know it does for some people. We would stay again!
It was a beautiful place to stay, small, quiet, friendly and within walking distance of Times Square and many other restaurants and places
Perfect location close to all subways and quiet but still near Times Square. Bed was comfy and free breakfast was amazing and everyone was super friendly
Great hotel, good location, comfy bed, nice workers. Only complaint is it‚Äôs about a 20 minute wait for an elevator in the morning
The location was excellent but the price was a lot (I guess nyc prices but still) for a very basic hotel. Breakfast was also very limited.
Great location, very friendly staff, close to all the perfect restaurants and sights to see. Will be staying here again next time i‚Äôm in NYC!
Good location in garment district. Walkable to most places you want to be during holidays.
We loved staying here! The staff were nice and helpful, great breakfast, great location, and very clean! Would stay again!
Great location, the staff was friendly and all needs meet. Enjoyed the waffles for breakfast üòã Would definitely stay again
The room was great The hotel was great location especially everything for the price we received The staff was amazing It was perfect for a mother-daughter trip
Great location and they held my luggage since we got there early. Staff was very nice and room was clean. My only complaint would be the elevators were very slow.
Communication was great throughout. The front desk was very helpful in printing a few documents needed for a business presentation. All staff members were very friendly.
Everything was as described, and super close to Times Square. Plenty of different eating places to go to, within 20 minutes of walking.
Facilites are great, very convenient, very close to the heart of Manhattan, accesible to public transportation and breakfast included makes a difference
The location was ideal and the space was all we needed. Highly recommend for anyone interested in the attractions midtown NYC has to offer!
I enjoyed my Stay. The area was very nice and busy lots of places to eat and being able to see the city was amazing.

The hotel met my expectations. I had no issues with check-in. The elevator was quite busy during peak hours, but fortunately, I was on the 4th floor and could often take the stairs. The hallways were somewhat dirty, but the room itself was clean. The neighborhood felt a little sketchy at night, and they lock the doors at 11 PM; however, you can still get in with a keycard. Booking through Airbnb means you won‚Äôt earn hotel rewards points, but it still counts as a stay. Overall, I was happy with my stay. I didn‚Äôt reach out to the host, but they appeared to be readily available if needed. I would stay here again and book with this host in the future.

The staff is very friendly, helpful and responsive. The hotel needs an upgrade. The bed was not that comfortable, the carpet needs a really good shampooing or better yet to be replaced. We didn't want to walk on it with our bare feet. The lock on the safe in our room didn't work. The stairs, which we used a lot, seem to be missing from their cleaning list. The lobby needs an upgrade. The breakfast is extensive with juices, eggs, all types of breads, muffins, pancakes, oatmeal and more. The location is fabulous, easy access to subways and main transfer stations. It's a very active hotel with lots of groups coming and going which was not an issue for us, yet might be an issue for others as the lobby has a tiny footprint.

We had a good stay at this hotel. Check-in and check-out were quick and easy, and the staff were friendly and attentive throughout our visit. When we arrived, they let us leave our luggage at the front desk before check-in, and our room was ready a couple of hours early, which we really appreciated. The room had a fair amount of space and while the building is a bit older and the showers were small, it didn‚Äôt take away from our stay. Our refrigerator wasn‚Äôt very cold, and when we asked the front desk if they could store our cheesecake for us, they gladly did. Overall, everything went smoothly and the staff made sure we were taken care of.
This place was fantastic. Perfect area for travellers and such a fantastic room. Wish I had booked them for my second leg! Definitely got spoiled when I saw my next Airbnb was like.

I had a wonderful stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square! The location couldn‚Äôt be better‚Äîjust steps away from Broadway, restaurants, and all the action of the city, yet the hotel itself was quiet and comfortable. The staff was friendly, professional, and always willing to help with directions or recommendations. The room was very cozy, smaller than expected. The complimentary breakfast was a nice bonus and saved me time before heading out for the day. Check-in/check-out was smooth and hassle-free. Overall, this hotel is a great choice for anyone visiting New York and wanting convenience, comfort, and great service.

The hotel provides a basic stay at a reasonable price, for Manhatten. There was shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and hand wash all provided. Towels, bed linen, fridge and coffee maker also in the room. The TV is very old and probably the original from when the hotel was established. This could do with an upgrade. There was housekeeping daily who made the bed, refreshed the towels and coffee, however, they seemed to not vacuum the floor, which needed doing by the middle of the week. A very basic hot breakfast along with oatmeal, yogurts, cereals and bread were complimentary with the stay. The Wales were made fresh for you if you wanted them.

You cannot beat the location! We stayed for two days to see 3 Broadway shows and the location was perfect. The only negative part was the bathroom wasn‚Äôt cleaned well before we checked in. The lobby staff were so helpful and kind and we were able to leave our luggage before and after our stay for hours so we didn‚Äôt have to lug it around the city.

Had a great stay. Was super convenient with the location being so close to times square and manhattan. I could easily get to any train I needed to. Close to all the shopping and restaurants you can think of. Furniture is definitely a little outdated, however was still worth the value. Front desk was kind and super helpful and the breakfast was def an added plus!

It was a nice place to crash for the night. I am a near freak though and found a hair stuck in a pillow. The shower was not very clean, stuff left on the floor. The toilet had a hair in it and toilet paper and was not flushed. Besides that it was very comfy and good walking distance to pretty much everything we wanted to see!! Looks just like the listing

I had an excellent experience at this hotel! From check-in to check-out, everything was smooth and pleasant. The room was clean, comfortable, and well-equipped, and the overall atmosphere of the hotel was welcoming and relaxing. Thank you to the entire hotel team for making my stay so enjoyable ‚Äî I truly appreciate your efforts!

We had a great stay at the hotel! It is extremely well located with it being just a short walk over to Times Square. It‚Äôs also an easy walk up to Central Park or to access the subway and other locations in the city. We enjoyed the breakfast and had a wonderful man help us make waffles. Thank you for the stay!

It was my first time in the big apple and I choose to stay here it‚Äôs the perfect location it‚Äôs not to far from Times Square it‚Äôs lots of stores / things to do in the area it‚Äôs also 2 parking garage on the block so that made parking easy ‚Ä¶ check in was a breeze/ quick the staff was very friendly and I enjoyed my stay I‚Äôll return when I come back to nyc

Overall the stay was quite bad, the room smelled as you enter, the place is quite small, things are broken - for example the tap works but clearly needs repair as it is loose from the base and is barely holding, the shower is small, and the ac handle is broken as well, the windows dont open so you can not do anything about the smell as well

We had a great stay! Great location with plenty of things to do. We were in a room next to the elevators and couldn‚Äôt hear them at all. Occasionally we heard some street traffic but nothing to be bothersome. Complimentary breakfast was lackluster but there‚Äôs plenty of great breakfast spots in the area to make up for it. Overall, we would stay again.

I would definitely recommend this spot to future guests. The room was clean, their staff was very friendly , and their continental breakfast was great. Lastly, this spot is in an ideal location in Manhattan as it is close to a lot of tourist activities. I will keep this place on my list for future visits!

Low end place, strangely enough they made me write extra info down after I gave my ID and Card, they continued to charge me double the normal deductible rate. Then I get to my room and the door didn‚Äôt work unless I yanked on it then pushed, fought with the door every time. The room was small and not worth what I paid for, I‚Äôve stayed at nicer places for cheaper

My travel partner and I had a wonderful stay! The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The photos and description in the listing were accurate, and the room had more space than we expected. Elevator wait times were always short for us, and it moves quickly! Our room was next to the elevator but we didn't notice excess noise from the room. The included breakfast was a nice perk.

Great place to stay in the city for a getaway!! Pretty close to the Subway, Times Square & Hudson Yards. Breakfast was better than what I expected, and I‚Äôm grateful we got a good deal here. Also very thankful that the front desk staff was able to keep our bags in the back before check-in and after check-out, so we could enjoy touring the city peacefully!

The hotel room was clean and the breakfast was as described. Only complaints we had were the mattress was pretty uncomfortable and the AC unit was very rattly so it wasn‚Äôt great for those of us who like white noise at night. Other than that the staff was very friendly and it was exactly as described.

Convenient location and close to Times Square. The hosts are very responsive and would check in via text if I needed anything during my stay. It was nice to have the hot breakfast because I was able to get out and start my day earlier. The only downside was it can get pretty crowded in the cafeteria room during breakfast & there's only 2 elevators for the whole hotel so there can be a wait depending on when you need it.
Clean and convenient. It was easy from check-in to check-out. I would definitely consider this place again.
No staff was present to help with my luggage while checking in and had only 2 lifts for 20 floors. Everything else was fine.
small room but great location and flexible check in time!! overall good stay
Great place to stay. Great staff and right in the center of everything to do in the big city.
Located in the perfect place and definitely worth booking! We hope to be back here again soon
Absolutely incredible location, price, and a decent breakfast too. Would stay again.
Excellent location, great host and yummy breakfast! We will definitely return!
A nice, simple place located not far from Penn Station. Overall, recommended.
Very nice staffs‚Ä¶ special the waffle maker and kitchen staff‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs the Hampton Inn. There was no issue booking though AirBnB. My Hilton status was recognized and points accrued.
Great for our stay in NYC to see a play. Could walk to our theater on Broadway.
Had a great stay! Thanks to the staff who were always so kind with all of my inquiries!
It was my first time booking on Airbnb, and unfortunately it wasn‚Äôt a great experience. Jason was not helpful or understanding, so I will not be booking with him again.
Good servis and close to all public transportation and very close to the city center time Square. maintain your friendliness in service, always be successful
Exactly as advertised, friendly staff, nice breakfast. Clean and staff very efficient.
Great location close to Times Square. Enjoyed the free breakfast!
everything was great, good location, breakfast, except for the elevator which was out of service for an entire day
Great location, friendly staff especially gentleman making waffles and front desk staff. Room decedent.
Responsive host. The included breakfast was ok - there was only ever 2-3 select hot food options.
i don‚Äôt enjoy giving a bad review but i feel obligated to truthful. the place was dirty. check in person was lovely, all other employees somber. great location.
Everything was great. Cozy and clean room and very central to get to the tourist spots in NYC and also the subway is very close. Can recommend!
Perfect for our 1 night stay after a concert at MSG. Great location to walk 15 mins either way to MSG or Grand Central.
Hosts communicated quickly and were very helpful. Hotel was clean and a good amount of space for two people.
Great location, helpful staff, & clean rooms! Waiting for the elevator was not as bad as made out to be in other reviews (in my opinion)!
Great communication. Room was clean and comfortable. Minor requests were addressed promptly.

This hotel is very conveniently located, between 8th and 9th Ave. The Valet Parking is very convenient, although it is perhaps $10 - $15 more per day than would be the case at one of the local garages--but, the convenience for someone arriving with luggage was well worth the extra few dollars. The people at the front desk were very helpful in all ways. The breakfast is very good, including omelets or scrambled eggs as well as sausage and good oatmeal and nice baked goods. I have only one slight complaint: the two elevators are very small, and it can take many, many minutes during the morning hours to catch an elevator that isn't full. There are at least 30 stories, and so it actually becomes very inconvenient to have to wait for an elevator (for example) when going upstairs after breakfast. I organized my day around this without much difficulty, including checking out very early in the morning. The room was spotless. It was not huge, but it had everything necessary.
Came early after long flight Front desk provided us with early check in which we deeply appreciated Clean rooms, good location
Great for a one night stay in NYC. Close to Times Square and held bags before check in and after check out.

I will say that this was one of the cheaper options for a 1-night stay in NYC. I guess you get what you pay for. Check-in was quick. They do charge you for incidentals that are reimbursed to you after your stay. There are only 2 elevators for the whole hotel so waiting to get up and down takes a good 15 minutes. We did not have a working TV our whole stay, no big deal, we were only there for 1 night. We did have an issue with the toilet. After flushing, it kept running water and overflowed. Huge mess. Our door to the room did not close all the way unless you pulled it shut. Huge security issue especially since we were in the room right next to the elevators. Staff was fine. Not great, not bad. Given the choice, I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Location is good, moderately well lit, still need to be conscious of safety walking late in the evening. Staff was amazing. Lady who checked us in at around 1 AM on 9/30/25 was an angel. Check in was delayed for some reason, but she took care of us with Water and a late check out time so we could get some rest. That lady needs a RAISE. 10/10 Housekeeping and breakfast staff were also VERY kind and accommodating. I do wish breakfast went until 10:30 AM at least. Breakfast options were pretty ‚Äúbasic‚Äú but there were many options so that was wonderful. Building was clean and well lit. The room had quite a bit of wear and tear but the linens and bathroom were especially clean looking and the small was mostly neutral, which is really what matters in my book. Bed was comfortable, pillows were NOT. Appear to be some sort of down filling that looked fluffy but flattened as soon as you used it. If you like flat overly squishy pillows you‚Äôre in luck. Would stay again if the price was the same.
Great location. In the heart of time square area. Great price compared to other searches. Great room.

The hotel is in an amazing location. The neighbourhood is safe and very close to Times Square. The breakfast was good. The staff at the front desk is very nice, but not really offering solutions or compensation if you have any issues. About the room, for that price, it‚Äôs unacceptable to find the carpet wet and dirty on multiple spots. I had to wash my socks in the sink because I accidentally step on the wet part of the carpet and they became black. We then had to leave a towel to be able to walk on that spot which was exactly in front of the bed. Plus the bed sheets were completely dirty, with multiple black marks. We asked for new one, but since it was 2 am no one from the cleaning staff was there so we had to remake the bed by ourselves which wouldn‚Äôt have been a problem at all if only they would have provided us with the right sheets, king size, instead, they gave us queen size

We were arriving late (like 1am). The gift wasn‚Äôt sure how to address this with the hotel, and the hotel typically marks anyone who hasn‚Äôt arrived by midnight as a no show. But, one of the hotel employees gave me an email address for the company that owns the hotel. I sent an email and within minutes received confirmation that we wouldn‚Äôt be marked as a no show, and the person also provided me with a complimentary late checkout. It was awesome. The hotel itself is in a perfect location, the hotel team was amazing, and we had a blast in NYC. The hotel location was so great that we walked and took the subway everywhere and easily saved hundreds of dollars on taxis/ubers. And, booking a room through AirBnB saved us hundreds of dollars as compared to booking through the hotel directly. Long and short is that we knew we weren‚Äôt going to be in the hotel room very much because we were going to concerts and clubs, so this was perfect for us.
NYC is expensive, but this fare was one of the lowest we could find and the description matched everything to a T. Would stay again.
Absolutely no-fuss, but convenient location, and a safe place to get a good night's sleep. Recommend!
Convenient to Time Square and Broadway NYC close to everything including the subway. I would stay here again in the future.
Room and Bathroom was very clean. They cleaned our room every day. Definitely recommended for the stay in NYC.
The hotel room was clean, the staff were accommodating, the the location was really good. I found this hotel perfect for my NYC trip.

Pros: - easy check-in, but can be a long line - only 2 attendants, and they have 30+ floors of guests - valet parking $75/night - can call ahead of time for a rush pickup - otherwise allow 60-75 min - free breakfast - more reasonable pricing for Manhattan - King bed Cons: - unclean - food leftovers from prior guest was not cleaned from pantry - manager was responsive about the above, but did not actually take action - small room - might bump into glass in shower - way too many guests for only 2 elevators - can be 10-15 min wait times in the mornings - free breakfast very crowded, but the servers work quickly - some furniture was damaged - weird smell, but could be from the food as described above - gym did not have treadmill - only elliptical, bike, and free weights
9 years on Airbnb Rating, 5 stars , ¬∑ August 2025 Great place to stay in the heart of Manhattan! It's in close proximity to the subway and the host was very responsive and helpful.
For the location and free breakfast, it's pretty reasonably priced compared to other hotels in the same area.
Very clean room and great location. Good breakfast options too and everyone is very friendly! Only thing was the ad said a hair dryer was included and didn‚Äôt see one
Loved the stay. Close to Time Square and the 42nd street station. A great central location to get to about anywhere in New York.
The location is really great, very convenient and enjoyable. The staff was friendly and provided good service. I had a very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend this hotel!

Good stay. Very helpful and accommodative receptionist who assisted with checking in. There was a slight issue with a roof leak in the room originally assigned but this was resolved promptly by allocating us a different room. Happy with the experience.
We enjoyed our stay in this place. We visited New York for the first time and the only thing we needed was a good location, a decent breakfast, and a good bed! It was satisfying in overall.

Wonderful staff onsite, allows you to leave your bags so that you can walk around without carrying them prior to check in. Check in was early at 2. Check out at 12. Location right next to the train. I can‚Äôt complain
I really appreciate the gentleman who makes the waffles in the daily breakfast area. Very friendly, helpful, and patient. The ice machines on several floors do not work though.

Not 1 complaint from my roommate and I. The room was perfectly furnished and well equipped with everything we needed. If it were possible for me to leave more than 5 stars, I WOULD. The location was not far from the heart of the city in Times Square. Many beautiful memories were created, and it all began with a lovely team hosting 2 Texas skaters who rested comfortably and felt almost at home. Thank you all very much for hosting us. We look forward to returning and booking with your team again in the near future!

7 years on Airbnb Rating, 5 stars , ¬∑ August 2025 It was a great stay. Host was responsive and welcoming. Location is super awesome and is just 5 minutes walk from Times square and the edge. Room and washroom was clean and equipped with all the amenities. Overall a great stay.

These are rooms in an operating Hampton, so it‚Äôs not a traditional Airbnb. The hotel staff was responsive and helpful. Facilities were clean and up to date, including the elevators. Location is excellent. A great value!
Great location, easily walkable to local attractions, easy check in/out . The front desk was able to hold our luggage for the day. Breakfast was good . Will definitely stay here again

We enjoyed the experience. The host responded quickly and efficiently. Everything was laid out clearly. It is in a great centralized location to Times Square and lots of public transportation. The staff at the hotel were friendly, helpful, and kind. Overall a great stay and experience.

I‚Äôm very happy with our stay. Check in was very easy! We stayed on the 15th floor, it was quiet and easy to access. The hotel was located on a somewhat quiet street but within walking distance to Times Square and the subway. The price was perfect and we are very glad to have found this place!

The Hotel room was clean, temperature was perfect, space was ample. The location was so close to transit and walkable to ferry to Weehawken. Price was good for what we got. I would stay here again for sure. Thanks so much! Also our deposit was returned when we left the hotel.

Really good hotel! Clean, comfortable rooms that include a small fridge (I like keeping some cold drinks in there). Everyone working here was super friendly, and they also helped me out when I wanted to extend my stay by a couple days. I liked the coffee and breakfast too.
I had a great stay ‚Äî the staff were very thoughtful and checked in daily to see if we needed anything. The hotel was well-located, and the complimentary breakfast was a nice bonus.

We loved our stay! Check-In was at 3pm, but we were able to check in early which was perfect because our broadway show was at 2pm. The Front Desk was super helpful even though it was a busy Saturday afternoon. They cared for us, even pointed out I should move my car to avoid a parking ticket! No hidden fees. Everything is clearly stated in the instructions they send you. Also, there were no issues booking thru Air-BNB instead of the hotel‚Äôs website. We only stayed 1 night, but it was the perfect crash pad after a long day of tourism!

We had an amazing stay! Great price! Easy to walk anywhere in downtown nyc from the apartment. Will definitely book again for future nyc trips. Easy check-in, valet parking service for a reasonable price as well.

Close to Times Square to walk there. A good base for a short stay, suiting our 2 night break. Family friendly and friendly, helpful staff. It is in a busy district so not a retreat in the city - it serves its visitors comfortably, suitable for Broadway breaks etc and for public transit.

It was the holiday season in December, and the yen was weak, so I had a hard time finding a place to stay for 4 nights, but this place is in a very convenient location within 15 minutes of Times Square and Grand Central Station, and despite being a Hilton, it was relatively reasonably priced, which was very helpful. It was quiet at night, and there were many 7-Eleven, fast food stores, and restaurants in the area, so I had no trouble eating. A fridge, safe, and hair dryer are also provided. Although the air conditioner was a bit old, the room temperature was stable and we had a pleasant time. You can also take an Uber in front of the hotel. During our 4-night stay, the bathroom and sheets were cleaned daily, and we had a peaceful stay. Breakfast is delicious and there is a service that bakes waffles. The menu changes daily, but the omelet with vegetables, bacon, and cheese was especially delicious and my favorite. Also, the host provided check-in instructions and messages about the trip, which made me feel warm. The only thing that bothered me was the crowded elevator. We stayed as a couple, but we were over capacity and had to wait a few times, and we were a little tired when we had to wait about 15 minutes to go down from the 16th floor to the 1st floor. The employees use the same elevator as the guests, and I don't know if it was a malfunction or why, but it frequently stopped on floors where no one was there, and the wait time felt even longer that day. I'm sorry to ask for a personal request, but I would appreciate it if you could avoid using the elevator for cleaning as much as possible during the busy breakfast hours (6:00-10:00). During non-crowded hours, I was able to use it smoothly without any particular problems. Apart from the above, it was a very pleasant stay overall. I was able to leave my carry-on bag after check-out, so I was able to walk around the city for a few hours before going to the airport, and I really enjoyed my first trip to New York. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è A Perfect Stay in the Heart of NYC! I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn Times Square South and had a fantastic experience from start to finish. The location is unbeatable‚Äîjust a short walk to Times Square, subway stations, and plenty of great restaurants and attractions. The staff were incredibly welcoming and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile. Our room was clean, comfortable, and surprisingly quiet considering the busy area. The beds were cozy, and the bathroom was spotless with good water pressure. Breakfast each morning was a great bonus‚Äîfresh, hot options with something for everyone. We also appreciated the free coffee and tea available throughout the day. If you‚Äôre looking for a convenient, comfortable, and affordable place to stay in Manhattan, this is it. Look, this is a Hampton Inn, so it's not REALLY an Air BnB experience. However, I got a great rate going through Air BnB and had all the upside of staying at a brand hotel: it was a safe and predictable experience, with a familiar room, decent workout facility, free breakfast (nothing to sneeze at in NYC!), friendly front desk staff (shout out to Fran!), housekeeping, cable TV, ice machines, complimentary water bottles and snacks upon check-in, etc. Room was small, as expected in Midtown Manhattan, but it was very comfortable for one person, the AC worked brilliantly during a stretch of grossly hot weather and the water temperature and pressure from the sink and the shower were great. Convenient location between 8th & 9th Aves, walkable to Times Square and major bus and subway lines, and yet pretty quiet at night. Really good pizza place across the street - although it's New York, so there's really good pizza every couple of blocks....

I had a wonderful stay at the Hilton Hampton Inn in South Times Square, New York. The reception staff were extremely courteous and went out of their way to make my visit comfortable. Throughout my stay, the team was responsive and helpful, promptly addressing any concerns with practical and thoughtful solutions. Their service exceeded my expectations, and I truly appreciated the attention to detail and hospitality. The hotel also offers very competitive rates for the area, making it a great value for money. I highly recommend this property to anyone visiting New York‚Äîwhether for business or leisure‚Äîlooking for a clean, convenient, and welcoming place to stay.

I have requested a refund via AirBnB and am awaiting news from both AirBnB and "Times Square South NYC."
