Furthermore, the other people present in the house also proved to be very welcoming. I am immensely grateful for everything and have absolutely nothing to complain about. Thank you very much, Gurhan.

Great value considering that you only need to exit Gurhan's property to contemplate the spectacular Manhattan view at night. Bus to the city is down the block and runs all night. The place is quiet and extremely clean. Host & his wife are really kind and Gurhan truly cares about his guests. Thank you so much!

7 years on Airbnb Rating, 5 stars , ¬∑ August 2025 The location of the accommodation was 20 minutes by bus from Manhattan, and it is in a great location for looking at Manhattan from New Jersey. The accommodation was super clean and Gurhan was super kind! Translated from Korean Show original
Everything is good except for the noise from the cooler.
Good cosy place to stay during travel to new york. Close to downtown newyork, easily accessible. good view, walkable to bus stop. Host is responsive, friendly and caring.

Great price for the stay! The location is perfect and close to a lot of NYC highlights. The staff were very nice and accommodating. The room itself was great and our partial view of the Empire State Building was a nice surprise. The bathroom was mostly clean, but the tub didn't hold water in for a bath and that was our only issue. It could use some updating. We would stay again.

Great location to Times Square and walkable towards the Empire State Building or to Rockefeller Center area. Like others have said, the staff are helpful and nice and the rooms could use an update but are clean. Elevators are busier during check-in/out times but we never had problems getting to and fro. For the price to be in this location, I would happily stay here again.

Good location, close to all the nyc hot spots. Easy check in and the host communicated well up to our stay. Only reason for the low rating was that during our 3 days stay I was killing bug after bug- especially in the bathroom. It made our stay unsettling and I was shocked especially for the price we paid that I was finding bugs on the bathroom floor, in the stair etc.

Really decent hotel- not fancy but more than adequate. Comfy bed and pillows. Great shower and quick hot water. Very fast elevators. We loved the location with easy access to subway, theaters, eateries, Times Square etc. Next time we‚Äôll bring eye masks for sleeping since the nearby giant billboards are brightly lit all night long. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Host were very good in communication. If you want a place thats right in the heart of NYC then this is the place. The room was good overall. A little dated and certain places like bathroom needed a bit more cleaning, but overall was good. If you are not seeking ultra luxury accommodations this place works.

Fantastic location! Although right in the center of Times Square, once in your hotel room (we were on the 36th floor), it was so peaceful and quiet. Staff were very helpful, friendly and welcoming. Only constructive feedback is the lifts were extremely busy and often had to wait up to 15 minutes to get downstairs to the lobby. Would be a huge bonus if food/drink were available to order to the room.
Beautiful lobby. Incredible staff. Especially Mark the bellhop. Bathroom just needs a little scrubbing of walls, but the place was beautiful. And so convenient to the theaters.

Had a great stay in NYC. Hotel was right in the heart on Times Square, walking distance to everything. Top floors were quiet, never had a long wait for the elevators. It was nice to have an entrance on 44th and 45th to get in from the cold.

Had a great stay. Room did not have a coffee pot as listed on the posting. The bathroom sink and tub took a while to drain. Other than that, the hotel staff was friendly and the location was very convenient.

The security staff were so nice! Edgar had great pizza suggestions. The location could not have been more perfect. Able to walk almost anywhere we wanted and close to trains for anything we couldn‚Äôt walk to. I am definitely going to try to stay here again.

Amazing location in the center of Times Square. The listing doesn‚Äôt mention this, I reached out to the hotel itself, but the highest floor they‚Äôre technically able to offer you is the 23rd. Anything above that you‚Äôll have to pay extra. Luckily we got an amazing front desk representative that upgraded us to the 33rd at no cost, which had amazing views. Beautiful hotel and perfect location. Would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in the center of the city at low cost.

Great location! Clean enough, ok size of room and bathroom. Has everything you might need in an arms reach around the block, you can see Times Square from the room windows. ( there‚Äôs a Starbucks and a Walgreens right below the hotel, literally)
Will continue to stay here every time I come. It‚Äôs a great location, especially if it‚Äôs your first time visiting NYC! Everyone was very helpful, it was clean, and easy to get to around the city.

Great location, clean room, all as described. Millennium offered to upgrade me to a suite for a modest up-charge, so I did that, and the suite was excellent: full couch, work space, 2 tvs in the room. Would stay again.

The Millennium was everything a Times Square stay should be. Busy, friendly, and exciting. Although somewhat dated (old furniture in room, stains on walls) the bed was pristine and comfortable, and the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. Well worth the price.
We had a great time at Millennium Broadway, host was extremely responsive and the location was just steps from Time Square! Great place to stay for a quick trip to NYC, we will definitely be back!

We booked for 5 nights. Upon arrival our room was filthy. Discarded peanuts on the floor, dried urine on the bathroom floor. The room was very dated. We were able to cancel the remaining 4 nights through the hotel. Apparently Airbnb and the hotel staff do not communicate properly. Our cancellation was authorized and within policy however, I had to stop the payment through my credit card. I have never left a negative review, this venue is unacceptable.

The staff were fabulous. Truly. Damien especially. He found out it was our Anniversary and sent up robes and slippers when we requested a coffee machine. How incredibly thoughtful! We enjoyed every moment at the Millennium and can‚Äôt imagine staying anywhere else on our next trip!

It‚Äôs not my first time staying here and it won‚Äôt be my last. It‚Äôs right in Times Square, close to everything you need, a 24 hour CVS 3 min away. The room is clean and spacious. The service is amazing. Elevators are super fast. Everything was fenomenal!!

The room was clean and the building is nice. Located right in the mix of Times Square and the theater district, and only a few blocks from the closest subway station, it was very easy to get anywhere we wanted to go.

The hotel was clean and the check in and check out process was seamless. The only thing to keep in mind is that you are basically on top of times square so if you are a light sleeper and can‚Äôt handle too much city noise this might not be for you.

Great location + affordable rate. Very central and near the subway so we were able to navigate around the city with ease. Lots to do in the area if you are in the mood for a touristy experience or want to see some theater! Would definitely stay again!

Location is unbeatable for the price. Noise of Times Square didn‚Äôt bug us at all but it hasn‚Äôt been updated, which doesn‚Äôt matter other than the fact that there‚Äôs carpet stains, clobs of dust on the walls and grime permanently in the bathroom and corners.

Very close to everything and walkable to lots of attractions. A little loud and bright due to Time Square but that‚Äôs inevitable. The only thing that was really bad - was the bed, it was like concrete! I just asked the housekeeping for three extra blankets as padding and it was somewhat doable. Other than that, the hotel staff very nice and accommodating. A couple of things had to be fixed, like the bathtub it was getting clogged. I‚Äôd stay again!

We have stayed at the Millennium before and we were so glad to be back. The location is convenient to everything & the staff there is always so helpful. Smooth check-in process and were always happy to store our bags. The host was always so responsive and made sure we would have a smooth process. And we did! Thank you!

Great stay at the millennium broadway, we got a free upgrade to 2 double beds which was very nice the beds are so comfortable. The rooms could do with a bit of tlc in places nothing major just a bit of paint here and there. The staff are great very helpful and friendly. Great location, although times square can be a bit of ballache to navigate because it‚Äôs always so crowded, would defo stay again.

The room was clean, spacious, and well-equipped, offering both comfort and a great city vibe. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows, which were too high for me. But that‚Äôs something personal. Millennium Broadway offers an ideal balance of convenience, comfort, and excellent service. Highly recommended for anyone visiting New York who wants to be at the center of it all without compromising on quality or hospitality.

This was my second year staying at the Millennium Hotel. It was a wonderfully, centrally located place to stay. All the staff were kind and very helpful! I will probably book again next year! My Partner and I saw 7 shows over the course of the week. Many shows and restaurants were in walking distance! Highly recommend!

We stayed 3 nights and can‚Äôt say enough about what a hidden gem we found. The hotel is right around the corner from Times Square and an easy walk to great theaters, bars, and restaurants. The building is total old school New York which was so much better than cookie cutter corporate rooms. The staff is attentive and our housekeeper was a super kind woman who always took great care of us. Highly recommend.

Unfortunately, the hotel was overbooked and I didn't find this out until I was checking in. The hotel did a great job of moving me elsewhere to The Muse which is like a block away. It was frustrating in the moment, but my stay was still good. The space was clean and nice once I got in and checking out was an easy process.

The hotel is located right in the heart of Times Square. Check in was a breeze, the room was exactly as described and we could walk everywhere we wanted to go. It‚Äôs located across the street from the Lyceum theatre. All the employees were friendly and the room was very quiet. It was a great place to stay!!

Perfect location! The room was spacious for NYC and exactly what I needed. You‚Äôre literally near everything‚ÄîBroadway, great food, and so many attractions just steps away. In only 3 days I walked over 70,000 steps, caught a show, ate and ate again, and loved every moment. The room was perfect for the price, clean and comfortable, and I‚Äôll definitely book again the next time I‚Äôm in the city.

Location was perfect! 1 or 2 minute walk and you are in the middle of Times Square. We could see some of it from our room. Walgreens right next door that had everything we needed. Bed was comfortable and the room was clean. All the employees were very polite and had smiles on their faces. I didn‚Äôt get the ladies name that checked us in but she was awesome!!! Highly recommend this place.

The location was incredible, check in is fine if you aren‚Äôt there early but their holding system for your stuff took forever to drop your stuff and pick it up. I‚Äôm wondering if maybe they were just short staffed this weekend because I rarely saw many hotel staff. Our room had stains on the carpet and the bathroom walls were dirty. Everything was just very worn out and dingy.

Amazing stay, easy check in. Only bummed on the no water at check in but had to laugh, the guy at the counter said the tap water was drinkable in New York. Fresh paint smell as we got to the room but it went away once the air was circling. Amazing location right in the heart of Times Square and they didn‚Äôt lie about the sleepless city

The location was great! Easy to navigate and right in the heart of Times Square. We were out most of the day and evening and only needed the room to sleep and change. Only downside was the bathroom floor could‚Äôve been cleaner. Had this weird stickiness to it and a slight mildew smell. I think that‚Äôs something that can be taken of fairly easily. Other than that it was a fine stay.

incredible experience. great location, can exit to 44th or 45th from the building. literally steps from the heart of times square. location cant be beat. price cant be beat. had an exceptional stay with zero complaints. i will be coming back in the future for sure!

Ive been a member here for quiet sometime so ill give them some slack however no mini fridge in the hotel wasn‚Äôt great we also had our shower drain clog so bath water was rising before we could get showered (they fixed right away) the first night. Also the room was so hot we had to sleep with the windows open the whole stay but again I‚Äôve been a member for years and will continue with them I believe it was just because of the holiday being so packed we got a back up room or something. Also check the pricing in the convenient store in the hotel we believe to have over paid for some things that didn‚Äôt have prices somehow skittles, Twix bar , bottle water and two key chains were 80$ ‚Ä¶

This was the perfect place to stay for seeing lots of shows. It‚Äôs next door to two theaters with another two out the back exit. It‚Äôs close to the touristy things, but also with close access to less popular destinations.

if you want to be right in the heart of Times Square for a reasonable price, this is the place. the room and bathroom was clean, and spacious enough. the check in was easy. it was busy but I only waited in line a short time. the restaurant is currently closed. but there are so many food options literally next door and across the street. I truly appreciated the luggage storage service and the bell man handling this was extremely friendly and helpful. the room did not have the superb city view like the photo but we did not mind. I did not check out the workout room. the staff were all friendly there! I would stay here again if I go back to NYC and especially to this area of Manhattan.

Besides house keeping services and employees being very helpful, hotel was okay but not what was expected or worth the money. Would‚Äôve spent more on a hotel if I had known the conditions of the rooms.

Booked this for my birthday trip and it did not disappoint, loved the atmosphere, subway was super close, the view was incredible from our room. If you‚Äôre looking for something with a view and everything right in a 5-10 min walking distance book this place!!!!
We stayed for our Honeymoon and it was the perfect location! Within walking distance to do many attractions and restaurants! I definitely would love to stay again! Thank you!!

Millennium Broadway Times Square is SUCH a great location to stay. You literally are on Times Square. Super walkable from many subways and food joints. Also super walkable for theaters. I stayed for a week and I paid a pretty good price. Next time I‚Äôm in NYC, I‚Äôm just gonna book this again!

Our room was extremely clean. There was a little bit of wear and tear, but not too bad. We did have an issue with the air freshener which was very overpowering. The manager of the hotel was excellent. He found us another room right away that hadn‚Äôt been sprayed. Communication was excellent . The Italian restaurant right across the street was also wonderful and we are picky about the quality of our food , it was excellent. Overall, a good experience for New York.

Must remember: hotels in NYC alone, or B&B rooms in expensive hotels, are expensive. It would help if the host highlighted all additional costs and NYC taxes, and explained what a "hold" is on the host's site. Jason was an outstanding and responsive host. He responded right away to my questions and made me feel he was always there. However, still do not know whether the $100.00 damage deposit "hold" was released.

Loved the location and service; the room showed signs of age that looked like a dirty carpet but everything smelled fine and seemed clean, just kinda old. That said, we‚Äôd go back. Despite being ten steps from two theaters where we saw shows, the room was extremely quiet‚Äî a restful haven. [Know that you‚Äôll be charged an extra $40/night upon departure per the fine print of the Air BnB contract. The price you see during the AirBnB price comparison does not mention this additional fee.

Clean, safe, and convenient to NY Theaters. It was so nice to walk across the street to the theater and most other theaters only a block or so away. No taxi, uber or subway needed especially after shows. Location of the Millineum was excellent!!!!
Loved it and very central location! Didn‚Äôt spend much time in the room but it was pretty spacious and they always had someone on staff who helped with local recommendations:)

Beautiful view from the room. The hosts were responsive & front desk was accommodating. The only issue we had was that a random man did follow us up to our room, threatened to S/A us, & put a piece of tissue over our peep hole on door so we couldn‚Äôt see out. I‚Äôm not sure how he was able to get past front desk security. We end up having to switch rooms for our safety and unfortunately got downgraded as a result of that. The room we got switched to had no view, no fridge, smaller & just not as good as the first room. I do appreciate them for looking out for our safety though.

The parking was perfect ‚Äî there‚Äôs a garage right across from the hotel, super convenient and reasonably priced ($80 for 26 hours in Times Square!). The receptionist, Seydurah, was amazing and gave us the best first impression with her kindness and passion for music. Our room on the 31st floor had a beautiful city view, and the location was unbeatable ‚Äî just around the corner from Times Square, yet still quiet at night. Overall, a wonderful experience! I‚Äôd definitely come back, especially because of the incredible staff and great energy throughout the hotel. üíõ
We had a wonderful stay. Not a bad word to say about this place. The location was incredible and only a block away from the Stephen Sondheim theather where we watched a show. Highly recommend! 10/10

I had a very good experience at the Millenium Broadway. The staff was kind and accomodating and the location perfect especially for those going to Broadway shows. The room and showers were clean and the bed comfortable. All in all, everything you'd need and want for a hotel's stay.

After being moved to a different room my wife and I lost out on the views of the per the Air B&B profile. Half of the outlets would not work and several unsuccessful requests of getting a refrigerator in the room that had been removed. Other than that a lovely hotel

What a great location right in Times Square! Lots of attractions and restaurants in walkable distance. Also very close to several subway stations. Great communication when our plane was delayed and we were arriving well into the morning after the check in time. Very good value for it's location
Was at this location the prior week and returned to it for my recent stay and it was such a smooth and manageable process; comfortable and accessible to my meetings and location was heart of the city

I was in NY for fashion week and many of my shoots and shows were in Times Square area so the Millennium was the perfect location. Friendly employees, nice room, very clean. Would definitely stay again.

loved our stay. it was right in the middle of everything and had lots of space in the room. bathroom was nice and big, which is a plus in nyc lol. check in was easy and the hotel was amazing. would stay here again :)

It was easy to find the hotel and it was in a busy, central location with lots of amazing stores and restaurants. The hotel room is a bit outdated, but an amazing view from the room window to see the beautiful Time Square plaza. The employees were very kind and the check-in and check-out process was very easy. The room was cleaned daily by the kind staff and I really appreciate their attention to detail. Overall, the stay was very nice and I recommend it, especially to first timers to the city.
It‚Äôs a great choice for everyone who wants to get the best experience in New York! Location is perfect! Just next to Times Square! The room is beautiful. Definitely worth it!

Got exactly what I need it! A nice, clean, comfortable room right in the heart of Times Square. It‚Äôs location is worth the price alone. Real close to attractions, subway stations and best of all, near really good food. Great place all around!

The hotel location is right on Time square. the beds were comfy and bathrooms were clean. there was a fridge but no kettle for coffees/tea. the staff were lovely and helpful at all times except when trying to drop the bag after we checked out. it seemed there was one bell boy taking an extremely long time with each bag and a qu√© of 20. or so. the manager wasn't receptive and simply said to wait in line. This process could have been a lot more efficient. Good stay overall.

It is an older hotel. As the whole hotel smelled good, like an air freshener, our room smelled like old cigarettes. The shower was old the wallpaper was peeling and the carpet was old and dirty looking.

Great location and great communication from the host. The place was clean with a nice gym in the building. Only thing of note and stated by others here is that it‚Äôs a little out dated and could use a refresh. But the room was clean and staff at the hotel were all very friendly.

The stay was decent overall, but there were a few issues worth noting. The room itself didn‚Äôt quite match the photos. Our room had some noticeable wear and tear that wasn‚Äôt shown in the listing. Amenities were very limited; aside from shampoo, body soap, and conditioner, there weren‚Äôt basics like cups for brushing teeth. Another downside was the lack of available power outlets, which made charging devices inconvenient. This place works if you just need a simple stay, but be aware that it falls short in comfort and amenities compared to what was advertised.

Perfect location, right next to Times Square. Very good value for the money. The hotel might be a bit ‚Äùold‚Äù in the rooms, but very clean and kept in good order. For this price I highly recommend this hotel.
The staff was great and the location was even better. Nice views, near everything, but not loud or bothered by the bright lights of the city.

I would be giving 5 stars if it weren‚Äôt for 1 major flaw, and a few small. The heat was out in our room. It dropped to 1 degree at night. Late Saturday we had maintenance come into our room to fix it, and they informed us all the 18 and 11 rooms were with no heat do to a pipe burst a week ago. Why did they put us in a 18 room? Front desk did give us the option to switch, but it was late at night, and we only were staying 2 more nights. We didn‚Äôt want to have to pack everything up. I wish we had. Since I woke up very early Monday (checkout day) w a high fever n flu. They did give us a later checkout. So front did try to make things better. Because of this I would stay again. But our room looked nothing like the photo. We had no views. And it said a coffee machine was in every room, ours did not. We didn‚Äôt even have glasses, we had to buy our own. I had high hopes for our room based on the photos and other reviews, and nothing lived up to it. But we would stay again!

The Millennium has an excellent location to spend a few nights in NYC to enjoy theater , museums and restaurants. The hotel is about 1/4 block from the greater Times Square and in the midst of the theater district. You are 3 blocks from the Times Square half priced tickets window ( tip: if you are purchase at the tickets window and are taking in another show the next 1-2 days, you can bring your ticket stub and extra an express line instead of the usual (often longer) line) and 2 blocks from the Times Square subway station ( Shuttle to GCT, trains uptown,etc.). This was our 2nd time staying at the Millennium. We were more pleased with our room last year as it offered in room coffee and a mini-fridge ( not in this year's room). There was also something a bit funky with the HVAC as the room would not heat and hold at the desired temperature. There was a very tolerable workaround, but something I'd rather not be bothered with). Net net, the Millennium offers a great location.
Room needs updating. Holes in carpet, stains on wall, bathroom was gross. But not bad for price and location.
Location is wonderful. The cost of the hotel as well as the cleanliness and the outdated facilities not worth it! Recommend choosing the Marriott across the street.

I felt as though the pictures were nothing like the room we received. We had to make sure that our room was locked at night because someone just pushed the door right open. The room was dirty and the door to the ac filter kept falling down. Upon checking in the hotel clerk was extremely rude however the manager came to make sure that after sitting for hours after we were told room would be ready (per one hotel clerk) and still wasn‚Äôt that we were able to get checked right in with no problem. The location is convenient, the baggage clerks were phenomenal, housekeeping could be better, and the little gift shop inside of hotel was great and super nice to my baby. Host did their part, some of the hotel staff just made it a little harder for me.
Been my go to place when I visit the city because its affordable, clean and located in a convenient area.
Spacious room looked just like the picture. Great location you can walk right into Time Square. We loved our stay here.

Check-in was fast and easy. The place itself clean and tidy. I didn‚Äôt see Paris too much. We‚Äôve been messaging about who takes the bathroom first, so it was good communication. Stay was positive and good. Place is small but very clean and in good place to reach to the place sightseeing in New York. Thank you, Paris!

My stay here was a welcome shelter from not only the surprise snowstorm that blew through, but also as a restive and very conveniently located spot. Paris was very proactive in messaging me, instructions were detailed and easy to follow. I come from a small town, but this stay made the stay in the city an easy transition.

Loved staying at Paris'. The apartment has everything you need for solo travel. Located in a really cool area in NYC and walkable to where you want to go to the city. I highly recomend for those visiting NYC. It was a wonderful place to stay.
Paris was a wonderful host. I appreciated her space. The location was perfect. So many subway stations close by. Lots of restaurants within 5 min walks. Great spot for the few days I was in NYC.

Our stay at Paris's place was incredible. We felt right at home, it was very comfortable. Paris was a great host and very responsive. The place is located at a great location, walking distance to 3 subway stations and a couple bus stops. It's walking distance as well to Target and Trader Joe's. And there are a lot of restaurants nearby as well. It takes about 20-25 mins to get to times square area from here via subway so it's very convenient. Overall, we had an amazing stay and we'll definitely check if this place is available when we visit again.

Great stay. Small (as described) but very clean and great location. Around 1 hour walk into the centre (times square) or 20 mins on the underground. Also well located for the financial district. Host was very responsive and accommodating. Good spot for doing runs along the river, and seeing lots of sites along the way. Plenty of shops and food places nearby. Would recommend and return.

We had a lovely time! Everything was very clean, and the location was perfect for exploring NYC. Yes, the room was small for two people, but it was more than enough for us. Paris was very discreet and quick to respond to any questions we had. The provided guidebook was also really helpful! Would definitely recommend and stay here again üòä

I loved Paris‚Äôs place to stay. I stayed here 10 days and felt at home straight away. It was in such a great location that i was able to walk to most places. It was close to so much yet I slept so good every night. I had everything I needed and couldn‚Äôt fault anything. Paris really gave you space so it felt like I was almost living alone too. Thank you Paris for a great stay! Couldn‚Äôt recommend enough

Paris was a very kind and welcoming host. I really enjoyed the neighborhood and the food is incredible. she obviously took a lot of time to get the website up and running for checking in and all recommendations are there. she was sweet in the apartment and very non intrusive on shared spaces. do keep in mind you are sharing a restroom with her so there may be times you need to use the bathroom and it's occupied or vice versa. this only happened to me once in three days though and it's absolutely okay especially considering the value of the location you are receiving in New York city. I'd absolutely visit again and appreciate all the free amenities with free earplugs toothbrush and shampoo conditioner and body wash. thanks again!
Can‚Äôt beat the location in the LES. Clean and comfy place. Paris is a wonderful host. We only met once when I was arriving, but she provided me with everything I needed and was always responsive.
Nice and clean apartment in a trendy and lively neighbourhood; Paris was an excellent host

Paris was great! She provided me with a guide that had all the steps and answers to questions I had not even imagined. She was very accommodating and help me storing my luggage before check in. The place is small, as shown in pictures but my husband and I were able to fit perfectly, and honestly when in NYC you just go to sleep to the Airbnb so it was not a biggy. I would absolutely stay again at Paris place. Also, it is 10 minutes walking from china town and little Italy so very very walkable and tons of things to do, subway was 3 minutes walking and it was very quiet at night. One flight of stairs but not steep

A perfect place to stay if you want to explore NYC! The apartment itself was lovely - really pretty and really clean and tidy. Paris was lovely to stay with too! The flat was is a perfect location to get out and about, with a couple of subway stations in walking distance. The neighbourhood itself is lovely too with plenty of places to see. I had a fantastic time here and would highly recommend

We had a really nice stay at Paris. The apartment is very tiny but clean and cozy and the location is super central. Paris was friendly and even though sharing the apartment, we felt like we had our privacy at all times. Even though it is central, it was quieter than we expected. We had a good time! :)

I enjoyed staying at Paris‚Äôs apartment. It was so clean, styled very nicely, and in a perfect location. This is prime in NYC - I would not hesitate to book. I lived in New York for 10 years and it‚Äôs hard to come across homes like Paris‚Äôs. She was a great communicator and gave straight forward instructions prior to booking. Effortless check in and the hosts accommodations went above and beyond. Would certainly stay here again!
Great location and clean place. Paris was kind and responsive. I‚Äôd stay here again

I booked this stay because the host stated she was living alone, but during the stay an unannounced adult man stayed overnight in the home. I was traveling with a minor, and this was never disclosed before arrival. This completely changed the safety and privacy conditions of the stay. In addition, the bedroom contained industrial dehumidifiers running constantly, which clearly indicates a pre-existing humidity or air quality problem that was not disclosed in the listing. These are not normal household devices and their presence suggests an ongoing issue with ventilation or moisture. I believe future guests should be aware that the actual living conditions differ from what is described in the listing, especially for anyone traveling with children or expecting a private and transparent shared-home arrangement.
Great place, great location. Comfortable, and perfectly positioned to explore the city. Paris made checking in easy and was very responsive

Loved my stay. The home was clean and in a decent area with close access to a lot of public transit and amazing restaurants and shopping. hallways are small and a little creepy, but still felt safe coming in late.

Comfortable quiet room, courteous host, room was as described. Has everything you need. Great location close to 2 trains making very accessible to rest of town. Proximity to a lot of restaurants. Highly recommend!
The room is tiny, but you‚Äôll find all the necessary stuff inside the apartment. It‚Äôs well located‚Äîaround a 5-minute walk from the subway. Overall, it‚Äôs really good value for the money
I was coming down from upstate for the night and I needed a home base. I love the neighborhood, and Paris‚Äôs place was super comfortable and quiet. A wonderful, safe, comfortable spot!
Great place to stay, it is small and compact but it was perfect for me and my boyfriend. Lovely places near by, walkable cafe‚Äôs and bars. I would recommend to stay around the area.

This was a perfect hub for my quick jaunt in the city. I loved how close the train was to the apartment. The space is immaculate full of little thoughtful details and free of clutter. It‚Äôs a cozy space but really well organized. It‚Äôs perfect for a solo traveler. I loved how welcoming Paris was, leaving clear instructions and warm welcome. The space felt private! The bed was so comfy! Also check out the speakeasy across the street ‚Äúattaboy‚Äù - thanks Paris!!

Great place to stay when visiting NYC! Close to some restaurants and a nice quiet neighborhood. We felt safe even late at night. Maia is friendly and so is Shabba (the cat)!! Always came to greet us before bed. The room is very small and tight for two people, but it was totally fine for us, and the bed was very comfortable. Thanks for the great stay and for helping make our trip magical!

Gurhan's place was the perfect stay for visiting New York for a week! It is beautifully located just a 2mins walk from the Hudson river with amazing views of Manhatten skyline. Honestly a dream to just talk a short walk every morning with that view! Bus connections to New York were also super convenient and Gurhan was super helpful with instructions. What I appreciated most was that he treats the place really like a home - he also lives in one of the rooms which is why you get more than the bare minimum equippment like in so many other Airbnbs. It was always super clean, the flat is modern and rennovated and the kitchen is super well equipped. The rooms have super nice storage options to make the most of the little space which is great! Gurham was a great host! The bed was comfy and the space was perfect for a quick overnight stay. The location was perfect‚Äîright by the bus stop. That said, if you‚Äôre sensitive to light or sound while sleeping, there are a couple things to keep in mind. The foam wall separating my room (room B) from the other half of the bedroom was thin, so I did wake up when my neighbor came home and opened their door (it sounded like someone was opening my door, it was that loud). Generally, everyone was quiet. Also, the bedroom door has glass window panes that have been painted over with white paint, so if a neighboring guest leaves the shared living room/bathroom lights on it‚Äôs pretty bright in the bedroom. I had to turn it back off a couple times after I‚Äôd gone to bed (between midnight and 2am). That‚Äôs not a reflection or Gurham, so he gets 5 stars, but some things were less than ideal for me, personally. Gurham was very helpful and friendly, and the AC unit worked great in the warmth!

When I asked if I could leave my bags after checkout, he went above and beyond‚Äîcalling the next guests to confirm their arrival time and allowing me to stay until just an hour before they arrived. Great view, good price for NY, clean room and very clean bathroom. Good location, room is sufficiently large for NY, very helpful staff. Only issue is that the microwave / toaster oven didn't work but that's not really their fault. Would recommend, 5/5.

needed to arrange a last-minute overnight stay, and this worked out great for me! Reasonably priced for a very nice, clean, comfortable room to spend the night in. I really appreciated Alex's helpfulness and attention ‚Äì when I first stopped by my room I was a bit nervous to find it quite hot (as they're still figuring out the heating during their first winter in the building) and was worried I wouldn't be able to sleep well that night, but Alex made sure to get the AC going and check that the room cooled while I was out for the evening. I came back to a perfectly cool room where I slept like a baby :) I very much appreciated the thoughtfulness! Thank you for a lovely stay.

We had a great stay in Chelsea. Cute room, friendly staff, and free bagels and toast for breakfast. It was a great stay! The place is well located, there are restaurants, bars, supermarkets and the Central Park is 10 minutes walking, also some museums. There is a subway 2m away. Great spot if you're looking for a cheaper spot to stay on the Upper East Side. Located near lots of restaurants and shops. Overall tight space but very clean. Decor/bedding could use some updates. The actual address was different from what I originally booked, but only a block away so that wasn't a huge deal. clear instructions from host, great location & access to restaurants/central park/subway. heat is not controlled by unit and was therefore exceptionally overpowered. even with window wide open (in the low 40s at night) + a fan, it was very hot in the room and uncomfortable to sleep. because of that, I probably wouldn't stay again but everything else was great.

Everything is on the listing including no elevator (fun exercise going up and down 4 floors) and noisy street. This is very transparent. Great place and amazing location. Comfortable bed. Great place! Easy walk to the subway plenty of restaurants beautiful area! Would stay here again

Good place to stay at for a few days. It's close to a station to get to the other areas of Manhatten/New York. The AC in our room worked perfectly and the bed was really comfy. Unfortunately there was webbing all over the upper parts of the walls, which could have received an extra wipe beforehand. Otherwise nice and convenient.

Overall it was a good stay. Location was nice and was close to the subway. Pay attention to the address she gives you in the message - that's the right one. Also the key/lock combos are a little different than described, and the front door of the building is finicky, so getting in was a bit of struggle until I could figure it out. For me, the AC was perfect and kept the room chilled

Great location on the UES close to subway station. Was visiting NY for a few days and this was a good place to rest after a long day as it was pretty quiet. AC worked but was just a bit loud. Celine was very responsive and I had a smooth, painless stay!
A+ host, clear and quick responses. lovely location with quick subway access and many shops and restaurants near by. would hope to go again sometime. thank you for having us üôè

30min with the bus to Times Square. I like the location and the price. l also like that you could come and go whenever you wanted.

Valentin‚Äôs place is perfect for anyone looking to explore NYC. It was sooo convenient getting to Manhattan due to it being close to subway station. There‚Äôs also so many good food places walking distance from there. Place was also very clean.

it was a good stay! they held onto our bags before check in time and the room itself was quiet and cozy. it was clean but there were some stains in the carpet that made me a little wary. they also don't have a free water fountain but they have a convenience store downstairs during certain hours. overall good price for this time of the year! very close to popular spots

Good location. Nice customer service. Room is clean. Nice luggage room. Near convenient store and subway station. No water bottles at arrival. Bathroom is a little too small. No hot water for 2nd day for shower.

9 years on Airbnb Rating, 5 stars , ¬∑ November 2025 Fantastic place to stay. The hotel is lovely and the location is perfect, being between 5th and 6th Aves and a short walk to Times Square. I stayed here Thanksgiving Eve and in the morning I just had to walk to the end of the street to view the Macy‚Äôs Parade. Highly recommend the hotel.

Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Shoreham Hotel for one night. The hotel was clean and well-maintained, and the receptionist was friendly and extremely helpful, addressing every request with a smile. They even let us leave our luggages there for a few hours after check out. Its location was unbeatable, right in the heart of the city, making it easy to explore nearby attractions and enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of Manhattan. Overall, a solid choice for a stay in the city!

Great hotel for budget conscious travelers that want to stay in the heart of the city. The hotel was very clean and well organized. The room was actually rather large for NYC, and the amenities were good. An amazing deal for those that want to stay in the city and be close to everything. Would definitely stay again!

The hotel was ok for the cost. The room itself was fairly spacious, if a little bare bones. We did have an issue with the toilet running which we informed the front desk about, but they did not get anyone in to fix it. We also tried to call down to the front desk to get fresh towels at one point and they did not answer.

First time booking a hotel via Airbnb and was a bit nervous to do so. I took the chance (seeing other‚Äôs reviews) and wow, so worth it! Check-in was a breeze, accommodated early bag check so we could get started on our early morning NYC adventure. Staff was courteous and the centralized location is unbeatable, close proximity to subways and we were up and down the city within minutes. Would DEFINITELY stay again üòä

the only thing was our room didn't have a fridge. when we checked in we were not offered to upgrade for $25 for the stay for a fridge.the location was perfect, the room was clean, staff extremely helpful with suggestions for restaurants, shopping, how to get around the city and how to navigate the subway.

It was a great stay, even though relative to the crazy prices in this city it was a lower price - the standard was high, the location great and all over a positive experience. The showers were amazing!
Perfect location within a short walk to many attractions or the subway. Quiet location except for noisy neighbors. Not the most updated but for the price and location it was not a bad place.

This is a great location in NYC to get everywhere! I love to walk and midtown is always my favorite place to be to head to Central Park, museums and theater. The Shoreham is a great spot. Super easy and friendly staff. Thanks for a great stay!

Great location, good staff, tired rooms, but clean. For the price and location, we can overlook stained carpets and surfaces. The bed and bathroom were clean. There is a nice pub frequented by locals and the after work crowd called Cassidy's. Good for a drink or quick meal.

The Shoreham was a great place to stay for our first trip to Midtown Manhattan. Very walkable to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Broadway theaters, 5th Ave show, museums, restaurants, etc. Price was reasonable in comparison to other hotels. Our room was small but very clean and the bed and pillows were comfortable. We were able to check in early but they will also store your luggage before and after check-in/check-out. My only suggestion is to charging ports for electronic devices.

This hotel was decent for the price, and the location was solid and super close to everything you want to be near. The room was fairly nice, but lacked common features like a microwave, fridge, and night stands on both sides of the bed. The bathroom was far smaller than it appeared, and there was really only room to stand at the sink (which was the size of an airplane sink.) The shower was pretty nice, but the hot water only lasted for about 4 mins and then turned cold (great water pressure tho!) The TV (streaming and cable) along with wifi didn‚Äôt work, so had to rely on hotspot which wasn‚Äôt a super big deal but would have been nice to have some WiFi. Other than that, this place was a solid place to get some good sleep after exploring the city.

Pros: Excellent location, fantastic walkability to subway stations and midtown attractions. Quiet room which was great! Staff were really friendly (always greeted us and tried to help us with any needs). Daily cleaning service which was lovely. Downstairs had a mini kiosk with coffee/beverages and snacks and an adjacent fine dining restaurant! Cons: Lots o‚Äô stains (carpet, curtains, cloth portions of wall). Needs an overhaul. Found a make-up stain and stray black hair (definitely not ours) on one of our bath towels. Cigarette smell on our floor but not in the room itself. Window did not seal fully but curtain at least helped keep the cold out. Phone didn‚Äôt work despite maintenance coming to work on it (though speakerphone did work!). No ice bucket and then when I asked for one it was dirty :/ To sum it up ‚Äî some cleanliness/maintenance issues‚Ä¶ BUT overall we loved the location and convenience and we were happy with our stay and how we were treated by the staff :)
Great hotel in an unbeatable location‚Äîright in the center of everything. The subway is only a block away, making it an ideal spot for visiting NYC.
Perfect location allowed for easy access to the cities best sites. Very kind staff and welcoming space contributed to a nice visit. I would choose to stay here again

Location, location, location! If you‚Äôre looking for the best location is this one. No doubts. The hotel in general needs maintenance, the rooms look outdated like the lights don‚Äôt turn off when you out, the doors doesn‚Äôt looks pretty secure, and the elevator is old but at the end you can rest pretty fair after walking around NYC the whole day. 2 years on Airbnb Rating, 5 stars , ¬∑ June 2025 This place is amazing! CAN‚ÄôT BE BETTER You can go to the centralpark, Times Square within 20 minutes by subway, no need to transfer hehe Above all else, Tony was super kind to us!! Good location, awesome host, nice place what can I say more?! üëç

Tony's place is really lovely, I felt completely at home and incredibly safe in a lovely neighbourhood. Anastasia is a responsive host. Her place is safe and good value. The flat is very clean, 5 min walk to the nearest subway. The neighborhood is very quiet. The place is excellent as a launching point to the city. Even though the subway is a couple of blocks away it is rather easy to get around. Great location in the middle of the city. The room was clean and had a comfortable bed. I never met Anastasia but she was very responsive and friendly when we communicated through the app.

First time in Manhattan, I arrived in the middle of a heat wave on a day which NYC hit 100F, for which the AC installed in the room was a life saver. I had a wonderful stay at this Airbnb! The location was perfect‚Äîclose to public transportation. The room was clean, comfortable, and exactly as described in the listing. Anastasia was a great host and very responsive. She let me check in a few hours early so I didn‚Äôt have to carry my suitcase around. Would stay again!

I choose Anastasia‚Äôs accommodation as I only really needed a place to sleep and store my items during the day. The apartment was very clean and easy to find. It‚Äôs is on the 4th floor, which was not a problem, but you can anticipate a narrow stair way. The apartment itself was exactly as pictured. Great location. A four-block walk from the Empire State Building. Lower and midtown easily accessible for walking.

Good place to stay. Small but that's expected in NY. I will say, it gets very hot and the AC either wasn't installed or wasn't working while I was there. It wasn't a big problem for me, but I could imagine in July or August that would be a deal breaker for many.

Located on 32nd Street in Midtown, it‚Äôs very convenient for visiting attractions, and luggage storage is available. The host communicated clearly and promptly. The room was clean and tidy. The place and the host were perfect for my visit to New York.

Great location. Clear instructions. Clean place. Great space!

Inexpensive stay, and I was only a short walk to a bus that took me to a terminal for subway access to Manhattan. I was thrown off on my first morning because the pictured windows do not get sunlight, but it wasn't a big deal. Would definitely stay here again.

excellent value for money for those visiting New York. Only 6 minutes from the bus stop that connects Manhattan, super comfortable and fast transportation. holiday inn was a good and comfortable place to stay. the rooms were spacious and clean, the restaurant not expensive with a interesting selection of food and the staff were helpful and friendly. boy did i enjoy & look forward to getting my daily bottles of water that kept me refreshed for the whole day ;)

13 years on Airbnb Rating, 4 stars , ¬∑ 2 weeks ago I had a pleasant stay at Holiday Inn New York City Wall Street. The location is excellent, right in the heart of the city. While the room size is on the smaller side, it offers good value for money given the prestigious location. Adding complimentary breakfast would make the experience even better. The doorman closed both of the sliding doors and we couldn‚Äôt get in with our key through the second door. Waited patiently, knocked, rang the bell, called, nothing for 30 minutes out in the cold. He finally comes out and (probably accidentally) admits he had been looking at us in the cameras but didn‚Äôt come out.

Fair place to stay in, fair price during winter holidays. Two free bottle of water everyday. Close restaurant nearby. Flexible with unplanned events, but my co-guest wasn‚Äôt able to check-in himself. He had to rebook another bus ticket. Laundry is missing. No cash payment. It has a great location near Fulton Metro Station, you have great choices in food nearby, like Joe's Pizza, Tacos #1, Simpl, Dumplings and Eataly. Excellent location, very close to multiple subway stations and local restaurants, and to Central Park was 25 minutes. Felt like a safe, clean area so late night trips back to the hotel felt seamless and stress free. Staff was always polite and flexible. Room were spacious for two people and very clean. The location was great. It was right next to the metro. It was a smaller holiday inn than others that ive stayed at but in a prime NYC location it does make sense! Rooms were clean and staff was nice. My boyfriend and I got to the hotel late after going out (around 3am) and we had to wait around 5 minutes for a concierge to come downstairs to hear the doorbell we were ringing.

This destination was perfect. Walking distance to the 4/5, Brooklyn bridge, classic staples like Joe pizza and los tacos! The front desk made our visit seamless and customer service skills were amazing! We will definitely be coming back here. Thank you to Kacey for giving us the smoothest check in process possible!

We were really happy with the value of this stay. Hard to beat the price, staying in Manhattan! Everything was neat and clean, the staff was kind and helpful. We had a little trouble getting the right temperature (heater was very hot) but figured it out. Location is fantastic. Staff were kind and helpful. There was slow drainage in the bathroom sink when I arrived and they fixed it quickly. The only challenge is the heating system (winter issue only?). It gets too hot in the room quickly and then too cold again when turned off.
really nice small hotel, has everything you need and they give you free water everyday. really close to WTC and the metro is like 2 blocks away. dunkin next door. great for the price!!
Very reliable and clean room. The location is perfect in Manhattan and everything is relatively close by. It was super easy to get checked in and checked out. Would go again.
The location of this hotel was perfect for me! Right in the heart of the FiDi. The hotel let me check in a little early, which I really appreciated. I would recommend this hotel.
Great price for stay! Staff was very friendly. It is small but suitable for two people! Walkable to great restaurants & train/subway. Recommend for a short stay. Many attractions nearby!

It's a clean cheap hotel with an excellent location. Its very easy to get to the metro. Rooms are a little small but if you are just looking for a place to crash after a long day of tourism/shopping/business etc you would struggle to find a better deal.
Very positive experience at holiday inn. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Room was as described and very clean. Location was ideal, very short distance/few minute walk to subway.

It was the best deal in NYC for this time of year. The staff was receptive, knowledgable and polite. The room and bathroom were clean. It is a 5 min walk from Fulton Center and there a lot of places next to/near the hotel. Overall, I would certainly go back.
Beautiful place to stay in Downtown Manhattan. Nearby so many restaurants and near World Trade Center. The room was very clean and the counter hosts were very responsive. Would recommend 100%

Great location! ~Just 5 min walk to World Trade Center; Nice restaurants with abundant options (Chinese, Japanese, Mexican, Pizza, Fast food); They also offer daily perks (some snack and 2 bottles of water per day), which is a nice gesture.
We stayed for two nights on a quick weekend getaway and couldn‚Äôt have been happier about the location. The staff was very accommodating and friendly and always checked in if we needed anything.

The staff was ESPECIALLY friendly and helpful. Always made sure we knew there were water bottles and maps available; plus popcorn and cookies every afternoon and granola bars in the morning. Loved how quiet the room was - despite being in NYC. And, the neighborhood/area seemed very safe and was so accessible to so many sites, including walkable to Statue of Liberty Ferry and 9/11 memorial.

I don't like to complain, but the hot water is on the cold side in the shower. The sheets were stained, and there was a lot of construction noise at 7 a.m. on a Saturday. The photos don't match reality. There was no water for the coffee. The location is very good, allowing you to walk around the city and have easy access to everything.

Great deal of ~$200 USD for the Sunday before Labor Day! It's right in FiDi, which makes the location great for transit and walking around. It's quieter on the weekends compared to other locations in Manhattan since it's mostly commercial/business buildings on the street. Pier is also close by. You can also leave your belongings at the front desk since it's in the Holiday Inn! :)

Overall great stay! Easy to locate and the check in and check out was very straightforward and fast as well as flexible! Appreciated the responsiveness to any questions as well! Room was very comfy, clean, and had everything needed. Location is great near multiple subway lines that go all over the city!

Cheaper place to stay in a busier area. The room is at an acceptable clean standard but no further. Corner clean and detail areas are missed. HVAC doesn‚Äôt respond well and after looking at other reviews, that seems to be common. Room smells (almost like the Indian restaurant on the first floor) not overly awful but noticeable and bothersome enough. Elevator is extremely slow. That said, if you want a hotel that‚Äôs as cheap as you can get without danger/ being very dirty, this is a good fit. If you want a clean, quiet place I‚Äôd recommend you look elsewhere. (I stay in the city 1-2 nights a week and have been through most of the FiDi area hotels.)

Coming from California and having stayed in hotels across the country and internationally, I felt genuinely comfortable and impressed during my stay at this hotel. The location in New York‚Äôs Financial District was excellent, and the overall experience made my visit both enjoyable and stress-free.

The host and the hotel staff made our stay as seamless as possible. Everything was clean and the location was perfect, there were tons of places nearby within walking distance. The Perfect affordable option!

The room was very clean, very comfortable mattress and great pillows. After walking for hours it was nice to jump in bed and relax. Location is great, just a short walk to Battery Park, Walls Street, the bull or Brooklyn Bridge.

I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn and had a great experience! The location is good just a short walk from many of New York City‚Äôs main attractions and close to several subway stations like Fulton, making it easy to explore the city. The room was clean, comfortable. The staff was friendly and always available to help with any questions or requests I had. I also appreciated the complimentary Wi-Fi. Overall, I recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York City. It‚Äôs a great value for the location, comfort, and service provided. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip!

The location is really convenient to go to cvs, pizza places and the subway station. Front desk is really helpful and wonderful. The only thing is the room is a little bit small and humidity. But overall was a wonderful stay. Thank you all so much! :)
Clean, pleasant staff, easy access, good location, good value for the NY hotel prices, but lighting in bathroom was poor, had to lift toilet seat to open bathroom door and drains are slow draining.

The host is not the actual hotel - it‚Äôs like a broker. They sold out of rooms and the host asked me to cancel the reservation at the time of check-in when absolutely it was the host who had to cancel. We had to scramble to find a last minute place. The host stopped answering and customer service had to intervene. Not recommended.

Ideal place to stay if you‚Äôre wanting to be close/walkable to most tourist attractions. Decent amount of cafes and restaurants nearby. Hotel kept our luggage for us as before and after we checked out which was a massive help.

The Place is just a little smaller than it looks in pictures, don‚Äôt expect any views or anything other than that it justifies the price , location is great, famous food option, close to subway, famous tourists attractions are nearby

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Holiday Inn in NY. It was so convenient to the subway and local tourist spots. We also liked that we could leave our luggage in the lobby before our flight back so we could still do some sight seeing.
Looks like the photos, simple hotel with a decent sized room. Great location if you want to explore the financial district then easy transport links elsewhere in the city.
Was cheap and worth it (compared to other nyc prices). The room is small but if all you need that place for is a place to sleep, it‚Äôs perfect!
Great place near the subway and great places to eat would definitely come back and stay here when I visit New York again!

My wife and I enjoyed staying at the Holiday Inn Wall Street which is three blocks from the New York Stock Exchange on the same street. The receptionist Justine was excellent and handled all kinds of situations. There is an adjacent restaurant called Ane which has delicious American breakfasts and Indian food for lunch and dinner, plus you get a 15% discount on the breakfast when you stay at the Holiday Inn. The rooms are relatively small but have all of the essentials. I would unplug the alarm clock since otherwise it will make a strange sound at an odd time of the morning. You get a decent view of the office building across the street, but more importantly you are within easy walking distance of the entire financial district and other highlights of downtown Manhattan including the Brooklyn Bridge and City Hall Park. Fortunately the room temperature can be adjusted to whatever you prefer.
Great staff! Always helpful! Quiet safe neighborhood! Close to awesome food and the subway!
Excellent place to stay when in the city. Staff was great and room was clean and comfortable.

I had a very poor experience during my stay. Throughout the entire night, there was a loud clawing/scratching noise coming from the bathroom exhaust fan area. I was not using the fan at any point. The noise was persistent and loud enough to keep me awake all night, and I was unable to sleep before a very early 3:00 AM checkout for a flight. I cannot say definitively what caused the noise‚Äîwhether an issue within the ventilation system or something else‚Äîbut regardless, it made the room uninhabitable for rest. Given the impact on my sleep and overall stay, I would not recommend this listing unless the issue is fully resolved.
Enjoyed our stay for the price that we paid. Convenient place that is close to everything, along with the subway being a 5/10 minute walk.

For my friend‚Äôs first visit to NYC, this hotel was perfectly located for doing all the classic touristy things. The staff kindly upgraded us to a more spacious room on the 19th floor, and we really appreciated how quiet the hotel was throughout our stay. The staff were not only very kind but also impressively efficient‚Äîhelping with luggage storage and retrieval, late check-in, and more. I was especially impressed by one staff member, Ms. Zaynah. In the middle of a chaotic check-in rush, she somehow managed to help us reclaim our luggage seamlessly. She expertly ‚Äúplayed Tetris‚Äù with suitcases in the elevator and corridor, let us grab our bags ourselves, and sent us straight up to our room so we could rest immediately‚Äîwithout wasting a single minute. All of this, with a smile on her face the entire time. Truly unbelievable service.
13 years on Airbnb Rating, 4 stars , ¬∑ December 2025 It was dated with rips on the desk chair and getting in was difficult because we couldn‚Äôt hear over the loud music. Close to subway.
Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, and the location made it easy to explore the city. Would consider staying here again.
A very strategic location , near to subway station ( walkable) . Surrounded with restaurants n businesses district

Location. Location. Location. First-time visitor or seasoned New Yorker, you could not ask for a better location. Walking distance to, well, everything that the Financial District has to offer. From the Stock Exchange to 1 WTC, here's your chance to hobnob with NYC's movers and shakers. Architecture, your thing? Luxury shopping? Be WOWED by both in the design wonder that is the Oculus. Pay a visit to the 9/11 Memorial Site and feel the reverence that all of New York holds for the names etched around the perimeter of the Reflecting Pools. Despite the scaffolding that temporarily obscures the hotel's fa√ßade, the building is easy enough to locate. After a good night's sleep on the most comfortable bed and a quick workout in the fitness center, there'd be nothing more welcome than a long, luxurious shower powered by a most generous shower head. The rooms are small but adequate. With so much to see and do, you won't be spending much time indoors.
Comfortable room in an excellent location! I would definitely recommend this spot and stay there again.
Great receptionists, accommodated us for our needs & gave recommendations! Space is small but it‚Äôs just what we needed.
Great location!! Felt lucky to find this place at the height of the Holiday season when so many places were already booked. Worked out perfectly. Will be coming back!

Clean hotel room. Bed and pillows were good. It is a no frills kind of place. Certain areas of the hotel are a bit worn and dated ( the halls, the check in area). Having said that, if you are just looking for a clean place to rest, close to the financial district, then it certainly serves its purpose. The air conditioner was set at 72 and would not change, the fan only had one setting which was very cold. We did let the hotel staff know it was musty (wet smelling) and very humid in the room. Great stay overall ‚Äì highly recommend! The location was excellent ‚Äì super convenient for exploring Manhattan on foot and by subway. The room was clean and quiet, and the bed very comfortable. The staff were consistently helpful, friendly, and attentive. A reliable, pleasant place to stay in NYC. I‚Äôd happily return.

The room was a little small but most new York rooms are, it appeared to be very clean, the staff was very helpful and friendly, the location was pretty nice, lots of stuff nearby and a couple of subway stations to get to more distant things easily, the bed was big and comfortable, I would stay again.

My stay here while I was in New York was great! The staff showed me so much love it honestly could‚Äôve just been my personality! The room was spotless it was quiet it wasn‚Äôt too far from the subway stations, restaurants in walking distance. very solid place to stay. it is clean, has great air conditioning, and it is safe. the bed is fairly comfortable. the "gym" advertised is a small room in the basement with two treadmills in it. no weights, nothing else. the hotel has no ice machine or water fountains or dispensers. the system of extending and/or changing your reservation are basically nonexistent, but it's a good place to sleep for as reasonable a price you can find in NYC.

If you are looking for a place to sleep that has a comfortable bed and a bathroom, this is the place for you. If you are looking for luxury, this is not the place for you. I went there with my son and we stayed 5 nights. It was absolutely perfect for what we needed. We left every day in the morning and came back very late to shower and sleep. It‚Äôs an excellent location as well with easy access to many different subway lines.

Wonderful for the price! Very convenient if you need to get around in a timely manner and definitely worth the stay just for how much there is to do within walking distance. Loved my stay at Holiday Inn. This location was so close to everything. I was surprised at the subway system in Manhattan. No car needed as it felt everything was within walking distance. I would reccomend this because it was one the least expensive choices to stay in New York and was close to so much. The host and staff were very friendly.

The Holiday Inn was everything I needed for an extra evening I had in the city. I wanted somewhere that had good connections to the city and this definitely had it. I wish I could write a better review. The location was great, the price was pretty decent, and everyone we interacted with were, at some level, very friendly. However, the biggest issue was that the Airbnb listing 100% said the room had a king-sized bed in it, and it absolutely only had a full bed. The size of the bed was a big feature in picking the room. After getting into the room and realizing this, I went to the front desk, who were fairly stand-off-ish and didn't seem understanding or all that eager to do anything about it (hotel was full, but no offer of partial refund, etc.). Moreover, they claimed it was a queen bed anyway (it was not, we had a sewing tape measure handy), and that a queen bed was bigger than a king! Airbnb co-host initially seemed friendly too, but was not very proactive at all in trying to resolve the issue either. If you're ok with whichever room/bed you get after booking, and ok with poor help if you run into issue, this could be the place for you!
